40802308.review:
Большой корабль. 3 монстра, 1 появляется случайно с каждой новой игрой и будет приследовать ГГ везде. Рандомные коридоры с каждой новой игрой, ключевые комнаты и отсеки не затрагиваются. Рандомный спавн предметов, нужных для побега, самообороны, открытия запертых дверей. Неплохая графика, анимация немного дубовая. Типо система стелса, очень легкая, но... Например, Вы спрятались в шкафчике, монстр пришел к тому место где Вы спрятались, он выломает двери у других шкафчиков, но Вас не найдет, если там спрячетесь еще раз, после того как он Вас заметил, он Вас достанет и выкинет оттуда, давая шанс на спасение в виде нескольких секунд.(как-то так) Всего я нашел три варианта на спасение: вертолет, плот, субмарина. Для них нужно искать необходимые предметы, чтобы спастись. Один и тот же предмет можно по разному использовать (включаем логику).
8 криков Брута из 10

40350186.review:
이 게임을 딱 2판하면서 느낀 점 : 

일단 소리부터가 부섭다. 팬티는 필수. 

이 게임은 아웃라스트처럼 브금부터 무섭다. 일단 내가 돌아다니기 시작하면 모친상하신 CCTV분들이 나를 파파라치마냥 찍어댄다. 

그렇게 하면 정말 부모님이 있는지 의아해지는 괴물들이 풀려나기 시작하고, 내 심장도 동시에 쪼그라들기 시작한다.

나는 이 게임을 세일때 DLC까지 모조리 사면서, 유명 공포게임 스트리머들처럼 존시나 잘할 수 있을거라 생각했지만, 그것은 정말 잘못된 생각이었다. 마치 돈주고 질소를 사는것을 과자를 사는 것 마냥.

일단 이 게임은 전반적으로 심장이 약한 사람에게 추천한다. 한명이라도 이 모친상하신 게임의 난이도와 극악무도한 공포를 느껴
 혼수상태 혹은 정신적 트라우마로 남아야 뉴스와 언론에 집중되어야만  제작진들이 정신차릴것이다.

자신이 공포게임을 잘한다고 해서, 절대 이 갓겜을 잘할꺼라 생각하지 마라.

템은 존나 그지같이 랜덤은 기본이요, 난이도도 모친상하셨다.

아이템 먹다가 몬스터가 다가와서 좆되거나, 탈출할때 걸리는 느낌은 정말 죽을만큼 짜릿해서 실제로 죽을뻔했다.

이 게임을 처음 플레이하는, 아무것도 모르는 당신들의 심장을 아주 땅콩만하고, 어린아이처럼 여린 심정을 갖게 해주는 아주 갓겜이다.

그래서 당신들은 괴물을 마주쳤을때 2가지의 반응으로 나누어 표현할 수 있다.

================================================================

1. 괴물을 보자마자 존나 울거나 얼음이 되어 겁쟁이가 된다.

2. 순간적으로 욕쟁이 할머니를 빙의해 들리지도 않는 모친상하신 우리 괴물님들께 아웃사이더보다 더 빠르게 랩을 하며 욕을 시전한다.

================================================================

이걸 보고있는 당신, 이 갓겜을 사는것을 아직도 망설이는가?

40244344.review: The only dissapointing thing about MONSTRUM is that there isn't more of it. Every playthrough is tense and nerve wracking. I just wish this experiece could be shared on more than one map. Still, for any fans of the survival horror genre, MONSTRUM steers clear of the convential linear jump scare formula in favor of a tense, vulnerable approach reminicsent of SLENDER or OUTLAST. Headphones recommended. Those with heart conditions steer clear.

40180602.review:
Finally got all the achievements for this game. For now i can call this one done.

This is one of the first steam games I bought, im more than happy that i own it.

As it is a horror game it does become less and less scary over time, but i found
myself coming back because I enjoyed the setting and sound design rather than
getting my face slammed by a giant molten boyo...

The game is definately scary the firs time you play it however, but it loses that as
you continue to play and is replaced with confidance. You know how to avoid this 
monster, you know how to play to avoid getting spotted, you know what items
you need to escape.

and when you do finally escape the first time you find out that youve got some more 
monsters to learn about and outsmart, and everytime it feels like youre Jerry getting
away with outsmarting Tom for the 57th time. 

I enjoy it. Get it for the gameplay if not for the scares

40111904.review: I got this game for the VR support and it was awful. It says its for Oculus yet the touch controllers didn't work at all after leaving the main menu. I tried using a steam controller instead with the rift and that worked even less. I reluctantly had to use a keyboard and mouse which did work but the controls were awful. Aside from having a locomotion system renowned for making people motion sick I especially hated the fact that forward movement was judged by the direction you were facing. If you try to throw a quick glance to the side while on a full blown sprint from a monster you will hit a wall on top of already being dizzy from the sprint itself. I do not recommend this game for use with VR.

39996424.review:
Monstrum 

This is one of the coolest ideas for a game ever...
 
How does running around like a mad man on a big cargo ship collecting equipment for your escape, while running from 3 types of scary but Awesome monsters sound? Crazy right! 

While being on a randomly generated cargo ship, every game you play is different, and by "randomly generated" I mean, a single Item such as a roll of tape that is used to cover up those pesky cameras that always attract the monster, 
"tape is used for escaping also" could have over 200+ possible spawn locations! 

But wait, there's more...... out of 200+ places it could be in, there are only like 3 rolls of the tape on the entire ship with 100+ rooms to cover.  This game is hard! 

I won't say anything about the monsters, but you should find out for yourself in MONSTRUM!!!


"My fastest time beating the game is 3 hours: 14 Minutes! LOL"

39251470.review:
Неплохой инди хоррор с жуткой атмосферой, где нам, будучи на корабле предстоит выбрать один из трёх способов побега (Лодка, вертолёт и субмарина) и собрать соответствующие детали, не попавшись в руки к страшным монстрам. Довольно интересно. Минусы: К монстрам привыкаешь, после попыток так 10, перестаёт быть страшно. Приходится брать некий "отдых" от подобных игр. А ещё, искусственный интеллект невероятно тупой. Сижу под столом, монстр проверяет все места, КРОМЕ МОЕГО СТОЛА, и так несколько раз)
Только прозрачный заглядывал под стол ко мне, но и то, он только отталкивал меня из укрытия и давал мне сбежать, да, во второй раз это не прокатит, но всё-же, забавно. Плюсы: Атмосфера, саундтрек, концовки, геймплей (сомнительно), кол-во предметов, игровая локация и рандом (предметы и всякое такое появляется в разных местах, разные монстры тоже случайным образом). Вообщем...Ну..в целом нормально. Рекомендую брать по скидке..Ибо 389 рублей..Есть и то более разнообразные хорроры, которые стоят даже меньше 200 рублей.

38737920.review:
Pros:
1) This is can work well on a terible computer
2) The items and I think map randomizes
3) there are 3 random monsters that you don't know who's gonna be next
4) The monster will search everywhere, and if they see you go into a room, they will searth the entire(or most) of the room until it gives up, or it finds you
5) The ship is big
6) I don't think you have to crouch through the whole game, which can save time.

Cons:
1) The hunter can be annoying. Like if you have everything you need for an escape route, it will come out of the wall and sometimes instant kill you if you aren't fast enough
2) It is sometimes hard to find stuff if you don't look hard enough
3) The fiend is boring. It does not walk, it floats. It makes a low buzzing sound which just wants to make you sleep.
4) Sometimes the door opens the wrong way. This is exspecialy bad if you're trying to run away from the 3 monsters.

-The whole ship, monster and item placement changes every game

Cons:

-There is always that one escape item that will take you hours to find
-Hiding from monsters only keeps them around your area, meaning if you want to keep moving without the monster near you, you’ll have to wait 10-15 minutes for the monster to go away.
-The Hunter (a slimy 3 mouth monster) will sometimes have no sound cue for leaving a vent.

Overall it is a great game that doesn’t rely on cheap jumpscares. But I am warning you, THIS IS A VERY DIFFICULT GAME!

Brute + Helicopter ending

Hunter + Life Raft ending

37144014.review:
[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
	[b]+ Три уникальных монстра отличающиеся друг от друга не только внешним видом, но и способностями и поведением:[/b]
	1) Brute (Брут). Один из самых здоровых и мускулистых монстров. Верхняя часть тела состоит из остывшей лавы. Через глаза, нос и рот исходит яркий оранжевый свет. У монстра опухшие человеческие руки и ноги, а само тело в сильнейших ожогах. Видимо данный монстр был когда-то человеком, возможно даже один из членов команды. Очень громкий при ходьбе и очень быстрый во время погони. Иногда без причины может идти очень медленно и тихо. В других случаях начинает "психовать" и делать небольшой спринт. Без труда с одним ударом выносит любую дверь.
	2) Hunter (Охотник). Самый скрытый и на вид скользкий монстр, по поведению напоминает монстра из фильма "Чужой". Состоит из прозрачного желе, виден скелет и внутренние органы. Очень длинные руки и пальцы. Возможно имеет внеземное происхождение, либо оно поднялось из самых глубоких морских глубин. Во время погони за игроком передвигается на четырех конечностях, в спокойном состоянии и в состоянии поиска ходит на двух своих ногах как человек. Любит скрываться в вентиляции и поджидать вас в засаде. В некоторых случаях может ползти по обшивке корабля и это довольно шумно у него выходит. Еще главная особенность в том что, из вентиляции может образовываться что то вроде слизи и это первый признак того, что с большой вероятностью он именно там. Более того, на стенах также могут быть образованы здоровые желешные непрозрачные пузыри из которых он может также вылезти, если подойдете слишком близко или наделаете шума.
	3) Fiend (Изверг). Самый бесшумный и злостный монстр в игре. Обладает телекинезом и левитацией (парит над землей). Люди обзывают его по разному: призраком, демоном, реанимированным трупом. Для меня он инопланетянин из другого измерения. В небольшом радиусе от него отключаются все электрические светильники и лампы. Если вы заметили что лампы начинают моргать включая ваш в руке фонарик, это признак того что он где то недалеко. Более того, когда он совсем близок от вас, то слышно жуткое гудение которое от него исходит. Это гудение прекрасно слышно даже если он за стеной. Способен намертво закрывать двери с помощью телекинеза перед самым вашим носом для того чтобы загнать вас в ловушку. Более того, если вы окажетесь в зоне его видимости более 5 секунд, то он вас оглушит на несколько секунд. Если это произойдет три раза подряд, это уже будет смертельно для игрока. Само прозвище (Изверг) говорит само за себя, если ему удастся вас схватить, то проигрываемая анимация вашей казни может быть одна из самых неприятных в игре: где он ломает вам руки и пальцы на правой и левой руке с помощью телекинеза и при этом он заставляет вас за этим наблюдать.
	[b]+ Рандом комнат, коридоров и местоположение предметов.[/b]
	[b]+ Динамическая музыка.[/b]
	[b]+ У каждого монстра своя мелодия.[/b]
	[b]+ Звуки.[/b] Все звуки сделаны на совесть и я не заметил знакомых звучаний которые могли бы использоваться в других играх.
[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
	[b]- Скудный арсенал обычных и уникальных предметов.[/b]
	[b]- Неуправляемые камеры наблюдения.[/b] Комната безопасности в которую можно проникнуть имеет мониторы с "неживыми" картинками и никаких взаимодействий с ними. Возможно разработчики поленились реализовывать управление камерами.
	[b]- Неполный рандом корабля.[/b] Модель корабля одна и та же, со временем вы уже будете знать все ключевые секции, которые не меняют свое месторасположение. Пути побега всегда остаются на своих местах.
	[b]- Шум, который вы издаете не представляет из себя то что должно быть на самом деле[/b] (не считая предметов для того чтобы отвлечь). Проблема в том что вы можете шумно бегать как угорелый, прыгать, поднимать и швырять стул, хлопать дверью, и все это не привлечет внимание монстра. Поэтому не имеет смысла ходить всю игру в полу присядь!
	[b]- Свет.[/b] Монстры никак не реагируют на свет. Они игнорируют свет от фонарика или от хим света. Если в комнате включен свет, монстр не будет видеть вас прячущегося даже под голым столом. Даже если в полной темноте светить фонариком монстру в лицо, он будет игнорировать ваше хамство и это огорчает. Смысла выключать свет в комнатах нет. Довольно сильный минус.
	[b]- Нет выбора сложности.[/b] Когда вы играете в игру в первый раз, игра действительно сложная и дает вызов вашим нервам. Но со временем когда вы уже будете опытным и полностью разбираться в игре, то игра уже не та. Вы больше не будете чувствовать себя жертвой убегающего от альфа-охотника. Это уже будет похоже на пробежку главного героя фильма "Хищник"(Арнольда Шварценеггера в главной роли) по кораблю. Помните как в фильме Арни ловко троллил бедного хищника, так здесь тем же самым опытные игроки занимаются. Единственное преимущество которое можно подарить монстру остается только понизить яркость до полу слепоты и вырубить звук чтобы дать монстру еще одно преимущество.
	[b]- Нет мультиплеера.[/b]
	[b]- Отсутствует Steam Workshop.[/b]
	[b]- Баги.[/b] Без них никуда в любой игре. Бывало что один из монстров застревал в комнате и оставался там, пока не наделаешь большого шума. А есть вещи где разработчики не совсем красиво поступили с игроками, когда на многие объекты лежащие нельзя забраться. Очевидно сделано чтобы не использовать это преимущество против монстров. А что насчет огнетушителя? Огнетушитель один из самых эффективных оружий против монстров, но оно не в силе потушить огонек, который вы можете устроить с помощью канистры с бензином и зажигалки. Другой пример неприятного бага: бывало что закрывал за собой железную дверь в спешке от монстра, но в итоге дверь меня цепляла и возвращала в комнату с монстром.
[h1]Не плюс и не минус[/h1]
	[b]+/- Только один монстр может присутствовать в игре.[/b]
	[b]+/- Саундтрек игры.[/b]
	[b]+/- Графика.[/b]
	[b]+/- Производительность.[/b]
	[b]+/- Концовки.[/b]
	[b]+/- Поведение монстров.[/b] Люди часто жалуются на то что монстр всегда знает ваше месторасположение и телепортируется, но в действительности это не совсем так. Он всегда знает в какой части корабля вас нужно искать и это сделано явно для баланса. Только Охотник умеет "телепортироваться", так как он все время находиться в вентиляции. Для игрока это неигровая зона.
	[b]+/- Анимация.[/b] Анимация передвижения монстров выглядит неплохо, особенно анимация вашей казни. Но анимация ваших рук и как вы держите предметы выглядит убого. При ходьбе правая рука с предметом в руках будто в гипсе.
	[b]+/- Управление.[/b] 
	[b]+/- Сюжет.[/b] В самом начале вы даже не имеете понятия что происходит, кто вы и вообще зачем вы здесь. Самое интересное в начале игры - это ваша стартовая локация, если выйти в коридор то уже не получиться вернуться туда на протяжении всей игры. По плакату (календарю) на стене можно заметить какой сейчас год (1977). Есть конечно всякие записки от без вести пропавшей команды и их голосовые записи на кассетных проигрывателей. Но толком они ничего не могут рассказать, только известно что какой-то из погруженных контейнеров взорвался (возможно оттуда и взялся монстр). Вы ничего не найдете о себе и даже ни единого трупа на корабле. Единственное что в действительности можно найти от пропавшей команды - это их кровь, разбрызганная по стенам, но и то очень редко. Еще одна интересная загадка, это то что система безопасности на корабле работает против вас. Все эти камеры установленные в коридорах реагируют только на ваше движение и при обнаружении поднимают тревогу, выдавая ваше месторасположение монстру. На монстров они не реагируют. А ведь монстры уничтожают ваши вещи которые издают сильный шум (радио и таймер), но камеры которые ревут на всю при обнаружении вас они не трогают. Как видите в сюжете больше вопросов чем ответов.
[h1]Вердикт:[/h1] 
Лично мне играя нравиться, честно, но она явно недоделана. Здесь много чего не хватает. К сожалению разработчики уже давно похоронили этот проект и никаких нововведений не будет. Поэтому вам рекомендую хорошенько подумать прежде чем покупать ее. 5/10

37074664.review:
Monstrum est un jeu de survie, partiellement aléatoire, plongeant le joueur dans une atmosphère étouffante et paranoïaque. Je recommande grandement ce jeu pour les joueurs à la recherche de sensations fortes.

Les plus :
- Une créature aléatoire à chaque début de partie, entre trois types de monstres différents. Chacun d'entre eux influence le gameplay d'une façon différente, et il y en aura certainement une que le joueur espérera ne jamais croiser.
- Plusieurs façons de terminer le jeu, ce qui augmente la durée de vie du jeu.
- Les items à ramasser sont placés aléatoirement dans le navire, ce qui peut sembler bancal à première vue. Néanmoins, chercher ces objets pour réussir à s'échapper force le joueur à se confronter régulièrement à la créature. Bien joué pour les concepteurs du jeu !
- Le genre de jeu à "partie rapide" idéal pour montrer à des amis et éprouver leur courage.
- Une ambiance visuel et sonore absolument parfaite pour ce style de jeu.

Les moins :
- Peu propice au speedrun.
- Une durée de vie malgré tout limitée.

35970334.review:
You awake within the labarinthine bowels of a deserted container ship. You are trapped but there are three different ways to escape. Which do you pick: the lifeboat, the helecopter or the submarine? Oh, I forgot to mention, each is in some state of disrepair and you are being hunted by a creature not of this world. 

There are three creatures (aliens?) in fact, each with its own way of hunting, and you never know which one you get until you encounter it. 

Three ways to escape. Three ways to die (not counting steam vents, burning to death or falling from great heights).

The best way to describe this game is as 'Alien: Isolation--Treat Size', and is also an absolute must for any Doctor Who fans who can take the tension.

35527814.review:
Horror games are a dime a dozen at this point on the Steam platform, but there are a few gems that manage to stick out amongst the pack and provide a terrifying and full experience. Monstrum, developed by Team Junkfish, could definitely be classified as one of those games. While ultimately a rather simple experience with no narrative to speak of, there is never a lack of tension within the confines of the ship you find yourself stranded on.

Monstrum starts you off as a an unnamed character who is aboard a seemingly empty ship, with no recollection of who he is and why he is there. While the “character with amnesia” trope is one that is commonly used in most horror games to ill effect, it never felt too forced here, as your sole objective is to leave the ship with no overarching story thrown in. You can complete the game through a variety of ways, including escaping via helicopter, life boat, or submarine. Each of these escape methods require their own set of objectives to complete but the vast majority of these are simply finding the necessary components aboard the ship, so most of the time you will attempt to escape based on the required items you’ve already picked up. However finding any items is easier said than done, as the ship layout changes every time you play, as well as randomly throwing in one of three monsters to escape from.

And the monsters are where the game really shines and becomes a truly frightening experience. While searching the ship for required parts you will have to be cognizant of either the Brute, the Hunter, or the Fiend. You will never know which monster you are up against until your first sighting, and each monster has its own abilities or means of traversal to take into account. 
The Brute is the strongest and fastest enemy, and is recognizable from afar with a red-hot glow that emanates from what appears to be a melted face. The Hunter is a gelatinous creature that can travel through the vents of the ship, as well as lay egg sacs that it can spring out of at any time. And The Fiend is a demon-like creature with telekinetic powers, which allows it to paralyze the player or lock any door from afar. Each one of these creatures is equally alarming and requires slightly varied approaches to how you will proceed throughout the ship. 

Not only that, but the character design for these creatures are truly bone-chilling, especially upon a close-up viewing. While the claustraphobic and labrynthine layout of the ship can lead to a great deal of tension, being spotted by one of these creatures up-close is something to behold, and never became expected or any less scary through each attempted playthrough. A lot of kudos to the sound design, as each monster has their own signature sound effect upon coming into sight, and hearing The Brute on a lower floor of the ship or the sound of The Hunter seemingly right above you would make my skin crawl time and time again. While the rest of the game’s graphics are merely serviceable, they are suffice enough to immerse you in your likely unsuccessful escape.

You are quite defenseless from any of these monsters, although you do have a few ways of prolonging your lifespan on the boat. Among the typical options of hiding, you can also use certain items on the ship to distract the monsters, or at least divert attention away from your escape. Among these are throwable items to lure out the creature with sound, flare guns which can pause the monsters attempt to chase you, and the seemingly innocuous egg timer, which allows for a delayed alarm. However nine times out of ten if you are spotted, your only resort is to run away and pray that where your final hiding spot may be is a spot the monster won’t think to check. Unlike other hiding horror games like Outlast or Amnesia, the monsters will usually check every nook and cranny in whichever room you are found in, so it’s near impossible to immediately lock yourself in a nearby room and hide upon being pursued. Your best bet is to run far far away and then hide, keeping out of sight of alarmed cameras or environmental traps which can slow down your escape.

Because of the rogue-like inclusion of permadeath and the monster’s perserverence, this leads to a much more fulfilling experience upon a successful escape than Monstrum’s seemingly similar counterparts. Where in something like Outlast you could almost always rely on a nearby locker, you are not granted the same forgiveness in Monstrum, and thus each encounter truly does feel like your last. 

And usually each time you are found by the monster it does result in death, which means a lot of the gameplay cycle in this game consists of simply finding items and staying out of site. Most chase sequences will result in death depending on the prowess of the player, and so the there is a slow burn to this game that generally ends with a heart-pounding chase or a truly relieving escape, and most of the time until then is notably less bombastic. While I am more patient with games of this nature and even appreciate the lack of an over-arching story or scripted elements inbetween, others may not be and could find this game underwhelming. 


While it can feel quite tedious from time to time, the sheer randomness and difficulty of the game means you can pick it up for an hour, give it an attempt or two, and come back weeks later without skipping a beat. If you were hoping to immediately start playing this game and binge it for hours in one sitting, it may not be as fulfilling for you. But if you’re in the market for a horror game that has legs and can remain scary during intermittent playthroughs than Monstrum is definitely worth taking a look at. 


I have put about 7 hours into this game, and still find myself playing it from time to time. This game has dropped to as low as $3.49 before, so anything under $10 would be a pricepoint I’d recommend considering. I’d recommend this game to anyone looking for some unscripted scares that they can keep coming back to, but I’d especially recommend it to any fans of Outlast or Alien: Isolation just so long as that they are aware of it having no narrative.

If you need any examples of in-game footage with less than stellar commentary, feel free to take a look at the link below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hH898rhazn0

35444844.review:
Nach 7 Stunden Spielzeit habe ich die Lust an dem Spiel verloren und für mich ist es keine 15€ Wert. 
Es hat so seine Schocker, aber im großen und ganzen ist es eine einzige Verfolgungsjagd. Die Monster wissen immer wo ihr seid und teleportieren sich um euch herum, dabei ist es total egal ob ihr gerade das Monster im Heck des Schiffes gesehen habt, daraufhin zum Bug hechtet nur um dem Monster direkt in die Arme zu laufen. Wenn man Horrorspiele liebt und diese oft spielt kennt man dies leider und ist schon etwas abgebrühter und achtet auch auf mehr details, die einem Anfänger im Horror - Genre vom vielen Wegrennen vielleicht missfallen. In meinem Fall fiel mir auf, wie leicht die Monster Porgrammiert sind, es fällt mir sogar schwer von einer KI zu reden, für mich ist das eher ein script, bei dem die Laufwege zufällig berechnet werden, wobei das Monster immer einen Mindestabstand zum Spieler haben muss. Wird dieser Abstand überschritten, Teleportiert es sich in die Nähe des Spielers. Je länger das Spiel andauert, desto öfter steuert euch das Monster an, also die Wegfindung überlappt sich mit der Position des Spielers.

Wenn man alles mehrmals durchprobiert hat, wird es sehr langweilig, weil man dann immer nur noch dasselbe macht :
Von Raum zu Raum rennen und sobald man genug Items hat, zu einem der Fluchtpunkte rennen und versuchen, Das Uboot/Heli/Schlauchboot zu reparieren. Sollte hier das Monster auftauchen, kann es diese Fluchtmöglichkeit zerstören und ihr fangt praktisch von vorne an, nur dass ihr nun von Anfang an die ganze Zeit verfolgt werdet. Die Zerstörung ist sehr schwer zu verhindern, da man die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich lenken muss.

Man hätte in diesem Spiel einiges besser machen können, z.B., dass sich das Monster nicht zum Spieler Teleportieren kann, aber diesen leichter durch die Gegend laufen hört, sollte er in der Nähe sein. Ebenso hätten dem Spiel mehr Versteck - und Fluchtmöglichkeiten gut getan, um mehr Abwechslung ins Spiel zu bringen. Abschließend hätte man dem Monster mehr Leben einhauchen können, also mehr animationen, Geräusche, etc.

35209799.review:
Monstrum è un indie che prende a piene mani dal survival horror, riproponendolo però in modo originale. La trama (data solo dalle note) è quasi inesistente, e onestamente non ci interessa in un gioco simile, sappiamo che il giocatore si risveglia in una stanza, che scoprirà poi essere su di una nave. Questa nave cargo alla deriva sarà la mappa di gioco ed è piuttosto grande, organizzata su 8 livelli collegati da scale, fra interni ed esterni. Presto scopriremo di essere completamente soli, fatta eccezione per un'entità mostruosa che si aggira per la nave. Ci sono tre mostri, il Bruto, il Demone e il Cacciatore, quando si avvia la partita, uno di questi sarà casualmente spawnato sulla nave. Come ci sono 3 mostri possibili, ci sono anche 3 possibili via di fuga, queste però disponibili contemporaneamente, ossia il Gommone, l'Elicottero e il Sottomarino. Per essere utilizzate, queste vie di fuga neccessitano di essere riparate o completate con alcuni oggetti che spawnano in modo casuale (anche se ci saranno comunque zone dove è piu probabile trovare un determinato oggetto di altre), la stessa disposizione della nave e delle sue stanze cambierà di partita in partita, mantenendo comunque l'ossatura originale. Il compito del giocatore sarà proprio quello di cercare per la nave gli oggetti necessari per "completare" una via di fuga, evitando continuamente il mostro. Fra trappole come le telecamere (che se ci punteranno per 3 secondi faranno scattare l'allarme attirando il mostro), porte barricate da far sfondare al mostro stesso per reperire gli oggetti intrappolati all'interno, nascondigli come gli armadietti e ambienti radicalmente diversi tra loro, ogni partita è differente dalla precedente.

Pro:
+ Ambientazioni assolutamente coinvolgenti che fanno trasparire abbandono.
+ Grafica che fa il suo lavoro
+ Mette molta paura ed ansia, in quanto non puoi sapere quando il mostro si farà vivo. Molta ansia.
+ Ogni mostro è diverso, ha punti di forza e di debolezza diversi, e il comportamento del giocatore deve cambiare in maniera sostanziale in base a quello che sta affrontando. Il Bruto è il più veloce, quasi quanto il giocatore, e sfonda le porte senza decelerare minimamente, quindi è letale nei cunicoli dei deck superiori, meglio nascondersi appena possibile piuttosto che scappare. Segno della sua presenza sono i suoi passi pesanti. A mio parere il mostro più tosto. Il Demone invece è molto più lento, ma non fa rumore (segno della sua presenza sono i disturbi visibili che crea alla rete elettrica circostante, anche alla torcia del giocatore, segno molto più chiaro di quello degli altri due mostri). In più può stunnare il giocatore con i suoi poteri psichici (per evitarlo interrompete il campo visivo). L'ultimo, il cacciatore, è l'unico a non essere una presenza fissa sulla nave, in quanto spawna e despawna dalle ventole dei condotti d'aria. Può anche emergere da alcune sacche di uova lasciate da lui in giro, che possono essere triggerate se il giocatore si avvicina. Per questi due mostri molto meglio scappare che nascondersi, in quanto se falliscono un attacco a sorpresa, sono troppo lenti per stare dietro al giocatore.
+ Il fatto che si siano tre possibili vie di fuga è anch'essa una cosa positiva. Il gommone, che richiede il nastro (utilizzabile anche per tappare le videocamere), la pompa e la catena. L'elicottero richiede pinze, 2 taniche di benzina e le chiavi, il sottomarino un fusibile, il faro, la batteria e il saldatore. Sottomarino, elicottero, gommone: difficoltà decrescente.
+ Design dei mostri azzeccatissimo.
+ Il gioco è piuttosto difficile, e scappare dà una soddisfazione ENORME.
+ Non si può salvare in partita.
+ Una volta passata la troppa paura iniziale è una divertente caccia al tesoro, capace di intrattenere per molte ore.

Contro:
- Animazioni del personaggio bruttine.
- Vari bug che però non influenzano molto la giocabilità.

35146292.review:
Its true classic survival horror. You are the lone survivor of a stranded ship in the middle of the sea and you have to escape the ship using any one of the three escape routes given to you: A Helicopter, A Life Raft and A Submarine. The only problem is that all 3 are non functional and you have to make them in working condition by finding parts scattered around the ship randomly. Sounds easy right? Wrong... as a monster stalks you on this ship and actively hunts you down. You have to avoid the monster and gather the parts for your particular escape route and escape the ship...all in one sitting.

With its roguelike gameplay,permeadeath feature and random map design, the player will always be on his toes as anything can happen in this game. It incorporates elements of strategic planning and decision making on which route you are going to take to escape the ship and also on avoiding and trapping monsters. I have never played anything like this...and its terrifying as hell. The atmosphere is great, the monsters are great and the sound is top notch. Each time you start the game a random monster will spawn somewhere on the ship and usually you will get the hints on which one it is through audio cues. Its a perfect blend of cat and mouse which pits you against the monster...and as you start to find more parts for your escape route it gets more tense as you are more concerned on not messing things up at the last moment.

It gives a new meaning to the word "Survival horror" as you actually try to survive long enough to escape the ship. This game is great for a multiple playthrough to escape through all 3 routes and win against all 3 monsters. Definitely worth the money. The performance and graphics are great and you will have a good time playing it. Just make sure to play it with some spare time in hand as  depending on your luck it may be over quickly or too late as this game does not support a save feature, but then again, it was not meant to, and that's a good thing.

34659096.review:
Das Spiel ist mittelprächtig.

Wir finden uns in diesem Rogue-like Survival-Horror-Spiel auf einem alten Containerschiff wieder. Man durchstreift den schrottreifen, menschenleeren Pott, findet Gegenstände und Objekte, probiert Dinge aus und ... wird von einem Monster gejagt. Alles andere kann oder muss der interessierte Spieler selbst in Erfahrung bringen.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125362091

Ich werde daher möglichst wenig verraten und doch versuchen, das Spiel zu beschreiben.

Es gibt immerhin eine spieltechnische Hilfe durch ein Journal, in dem Aufgaben nachzulesen sind. Dies wird aktualisiert, wenn man gewisse Dinge gefunden oder erreicht hat. Notizen, die man ab und an findet, werden dort auch aufbewahrt. Das ist nett, hilft einem bald aber nicht weiter (die Aufgaben kennt man schnell auswendig).

Ein glückliches Ende in dem Spiel zu erreichen ist dennoch eine wirkliche Herausforderung und das liegt an diesem Monstrum. Klar, man kann vieles falsch machen, aber es hängt doch viel von Zufällen ab. Es kann sein, man bleibt lange ungestört und findet rasch die gewünschten Objekte. Genauso kann man viel auf der Flucht sein und/oder die Objekte, die man braucht, viel zu lange nicht finden.

Früher oder später wird man dem Monster, das man meist schon mal gehört hat, auch sehen. Dann beginnt eine wilde Flucht, die allzuoft tödlich endet. Panik, Adrenalin und Herzrasen inbegriffen. Umso mehr, je näher man sich seinem Ziel wähnte. Verstecke scheinen auch eine gute Idee. Vielleicht gibt es noch andere Möglichkeiten? Nicht viel.

Mit dem Monster, man ahnt es vielleicht, habe ich so meine Probleme, bei dem ansonsten recht angenehmen Spiel. Wäre sein Verhalten sehr berechenbar, wäre das Spiel zu leicht. Würde man nicht mal digital sterben, wäre es langweilig. Aber viel zu oft fand ich es zu unfair, ohne Chance des Entkommens oder Versteckmöglichkeit. Seine Laufwege sind nicht vorhersehbar, es kann vermutlich teleportieren. Bei einem rouge-like Spiel finde ich das nicht nett, habe aber auch nicht viel Erfahrung in dem Genre.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125359648

Ich hatte gehofft, man (oder zumindest ich) könne die Bedrohung des Monsters, obwohl vorhanden, besser in den Griff bekommen.

Andererseits, habe ich bislang gerademal 4 (und keine 30) Stunden gespielt. Es würde schon irgendwann klappen. Ich bin aber leider nicht der Spieler, der beliebig oft teils aufwendige Versuche durchspielt. Dazu fehlt mir die Geduld. Ich brauche offenbar doch entweder eine Speicherfunktion oder etwas mehr Berechenbarkeit.

Stirbt man, beginnt man völlig von vorne, in einem neuen Schiff, in dem zwar die grobe Aufteilung (Abteilungen, Decktyp, u.a.) konstant, aber die Einzelheiten wieder völlig neu sind (was noch alles anders sein kann, wird man herausfinden, ebenso manche Tricks, die aber nicht immer funktionieren). Das macht das Spiel natürlich interessant und abwechslungsreich.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125361402

Die Grafik ist ausreichend, nichts besonderes. Viele Räume und Gänge sind sich zu ähnlich.

Mit dem Sound ist es so eine Sache. So wie ich es sehe, soll er ja dazu dienen, das Monster zu orten. Erstens muss man die Geräusche des Monsters von anderen Geräuschenunterscheiden können und zweitens die Entfernung und Richtung abschätzen können. Beides gelang mir nicht recht gut.

Die Steuerung mit Tastatur und Maus oder mit Controller ist einfach.

Es gibt einige Errungenschaften, die (für mich) meist nicht einfach zu erhalten sind.

Pro & Contra:

+ Sehr gutes Setting (allein auf einem Schiff)
+ Prozeduraler, zufälliger Aufbau
+ Wenige, aber interessante Aufgabe(n)
+ Nette Details

o Die Grafik ist mittelprächtig
o Ohne Monster wäre das Spiel schnell erledigt

- Die Begegnung mit dem Monster kann unfair sein
- Die Ortung mittels Sound ist schwierig
- Die Bewegung des Monsters ist (für mich) unnachvollziehbar
- Viele Räume sind fast identisch

Wertung: 5/10 (leider, der Spaßfaktor)

Ich fand das Spiel zwar von der Idee her gut, aber das Monster zu mächtig. Nach ewig vielen Bildschirmtoden ohne einem einzigen Erfolg wurde es mir zuviel.

Für Fans des Genres, insofern diese mit den (potentiell) sehr vielen Fehlversuchen bzw. dem Monster zurecht kommen und die Herausforderung lieben, sicher ein Leckerbissen.

34245754.review:
GREAT FOR BEGINNER SURVIVAL HORROR PLAYERS

This game is a great tool to learn how to play survival horror. It's arcadey. It's rules are consistant, the map and monster change every round, items spawn in set areas, and items can be hidden pretty much anywhere in their area. Playing this, you learn how to listen and distinguish sounds both good and bad, learn how to run and pay attention to your physical and sound presence, and learn how to begin facing the fear of imminent threat coming for you (Monster or other entity).

I don't really have any negatives that concern the value of buying this game. It's a wonderful tool to teach new players how to play the survival horror genre, and it's a nice time filler for seasoned survival horror players.

Anyone interested in the survival horror genre should play this game. From first timers to the veterans. It's absolutely worth it.

34116799.review:
I have the Oculus Rift and I played this using a controller.  This is one of the most amazing and immersive horror game experiences in VR at the moment.  If you have an Oculus Rift this is a must buy.  However, it's not perfect but still I give it a 9/10 and here's why:

The graphics are good but not great (doesn't look anything like a triple AAA title, especially now in 2017).  There's also some graphical glitches, you can make your head go through a door just by moving and your hand or items can pop out out of areas (like when you're hiding in a locker).  That does kill some of the immersion.  However, ignore those hand glitches and don't try to go through doors and it shouldn't be an issue.  The monsters could be higher quality graphics and scarier looking as well, they look just a little too cartoony.  

Otherwise, this is simply a fantastic horror experience that you always dreamed about.  I don't know  a game that better captures the feeling for being chased by something horrible and having to use your wits to escape the situation.  The gameplay makes you forget about the above mentioned problems, it is that good.

9/10 (yeah it's not perfect, but it's the best of its genre in VR currently and with support for Touch controllers and room-scale, along with better graphics, and some bug fixes, and this game would be an instant classic, it's that close to perfection, no additional story, cinematics or QTE needed)

33615312.review:
Bueno, pues tras años riéndome de los juegos supuestamente terroríficos, por fin he encontrado uno que si que realmente genera miedo. El Monstrum es un inquietante juego que parte de una premisa muy básica: estás atrapado en un buque mercante y tienes que tratar de escapar mientras un monstruo te persigue para matarte. Transcurre en un ambiente terriblemente sofocante, un gran buque abandonado a la deriva y en un lamentable estado, casi puede olerse el olor de la corrosión salina carcomiendo el caso y la aplastante atmósfera es probablemente el punto fuerte de este juego.

Hay tres tipos de monstruos, cada uno con una actitud e inteligencia artificial completamente diferente de las de los demás, hay uno que es una mole cuyos pasos resuenan por los pasillos del barco y que como te vea sale corriendo detrás de ti destruyendo todo lo que se cruce en su camino, otro es una especie de arácnido cazador que te pone trampas y se te puede echar encima saliendo repentinamente desde cualquier rejilla de ventilación, y el tercero es una especie de ente eléctrico extremadamente inteligente.

Para escapar puedes usar una lancha salvavidas, un helicóptero o un submarino, el problema es que a todos les faltan piezas o hay que hacerles alguna reparación, por lo que realmente el juego consiste en recorrer el barco, que está construido pensando en dotarlo de un razonable realismo (hay un puente de mando, sala de máquinas, varias cubiertas con talleres, almacenes, alojamientos de la tripulación, bodega de carga, etcétera), buscando las piezas necesarias mientras aguantas la respiración en cada esquina esperando no darte de bruces contra el monstruo que sea.

No es que el monstruo surja de pronto por la cara (salvo el cazador, que a veces se esconde y te pilla desprevenido), los monstruos no desaparecen en ningún momento, aunque no los veas están siempre en alguna parte en concreto buscándote y si haces ruido se irán acercando cada vez más a ti. Eso también juega en tu favor porque si estás a punto de escapar y tienes que hacer ruido en alguna zona puedes atraerles a la otra punta del barco para ganar tiempo, por ejemplo encendiendo una radio.

La ubicación de los objetos e incluso la disposición de los pasillos de camarotes y talleres van cambiando de partida en partida (salvo las zonas realmente importantes como el puente o la sala de máquinas que siempre están en el mismo sitio), por lo que cada partida es diferente.

Los gráficos, el sonido, y el ambiente de humedad y corrosión están logradísimos, es realmente acojonante caminar por los entresijos del buque tratando de andar de puntillas mientras escuchas retumbar los pasos del monstruo en la cubierta inmediatamente superior (para sacarle todo el jugo es imperativo jugar a oscuras y en silencio, claro). 

Tiene una dificultad media alta, a veces llegas a exasperarte buscando tal o cual pieza que no acaba de aparecer y siempre el peor momento es cuando tienes todo y estás a punto de escapar, porque es el momento en el que más ruido haces y siempre suele aparecer algún invitado indeseado. Yo hasta las 6 horas de juego no empecé a tener posibilidades reales de escapar, y ha sido a las 14 horas cuando he conseguido alcanzar el 100% de los logros y terminarme el juego.

En general, es un juego muy recomendable, incluso a precio no rebajado, en mi caso particular ha sido la primera y hasta ahora única ocasión en que un videojuego me ha hecho sentir algo cercano al miedo, así que no puedo sino recomendarlo vivamente porque además dos años después de su publicación todavía se siguen publicando mejoras y parches gratuitos.

33423013.review:
Spoiler free-review, so I will be vague.

BLUFF:  I enjoyed this game immensely.  Though, like with many things, the unknown is more horrifying than the known. 
 The horror aspect is mostly gone after around the first 6 playthroughs, and I found it dropped considerably after I was finally successful at escaping the first time.  That said, it's still highly enjoyable, as you learn more about the habits of the various monsters and how to avoid them.  Each has different strengths, weaknesses, and special abilities.  

This amounts to a horrorifying combination of a scavanger hunt, hide&seek, and tag.  Where the monster is always it, and can end it with a single touch.  You can avoid this by hiding or running away, but the procedurally generated ship map will often have you going down blind cooridors with no alternative exit.  You need to go down them at least once to check for the items you need to escape, but the monsters are smart enough to know that if they haven't seen any other exits that you're probably hiding in the room at the end of the hallway.  Don't think you're safe just because you're hiding in a locked room.

33376941.review:
Годная, но сильно не хватает настроек сложности/легко/средне/сложно. Из-за этого пройти игру становится сложно. Но это добавляет уникальную атмосферу, котороую невозможно забыть, горький вкус постоянной паники, которую испытываешь на каждой палубе. Игровой процесс хороший, но игра херово проработана, бывают баги и вылеты. И управление не удобное, а в панике когда за тобой несётся орущая страшная мразь, бывает так по клавишам оттарабанишь, и тут демонстрируется жопское управление. Надо присесть, а по приседанию надо подождать секунду, и аотом гп садится. А блядь при панике нажимаешь много раз, считая что не нажал достачно чтоб присесть. Тут 20 раз попрыгав в ужасе и 30 раз хардбассил приседаниями, прибегает залупный гуманоид и даёт батин лещ, который является смертельным. А так всё хорошо, кроме управления.
9 из 10 Брутов

33292563.review:
Had several technical issues on startup (gamma set to 0 making it near impossible to see anything in menu, with luck i was able to fix that). 
Some genious thought its a clever idea to have the gamma setting not only influence the visuals in the game, but also literally everything in the game, including every font (including options text and clickable buttons) or even the company logo on game startup (screenshot of blackness on my profile). 
Also, ofcourse, the gamma setting itself, which made it impossible to change it in the first place. Some wild clicks later, while having a black screen with basically nothing on it, i managed to get gamma up again and finally see something. 
Following the game looked so bad while running totally unstable dropping often to below 30, that i wished the gamma would have stayed at 0. 
Some other settings were also messed up, but finally i could set the game at least right.

On top though what i played wasnt really fun. 
I wandered an empty crappy looking ship with a maximum up 70FOV and muddy textures and FPS constantly jumping from stable 60 inside the ship, to nearly below 20 when leaving and going outside.
I collected some random stuff and somehow managed to collect half of the items i needed to complete one escape route. Just that i managed to do that twice but couldnt find anything else to even complete one.
And so i wandered around the ship, without a map or any real help to figure out where i already was or currently am, while followed by a monster that sounded creepy and looked somewhat refreshing (design wise).
Magically it appeared where i was, though, all the time. 
I had seen it on one level of the ship (like Level 6) with peeking around a corner and seeing it entering a hallway that is very long. 
I then ran to a level below it (level 5),while hearing it wandering through the floors of level 6 (sounds indicated it constantly just walking straight ahead), just to somehow have it come around the corner on my level infront of me, although it couldnt be there and no sound would have indicated a special move that allowed it to change the floor and also appear inside an enclosed hallway that has only 2 entrances.
But ok, cheating AI monster aside, i can deal with that. But it shows that its more going for the cheap side than the clever side of gameplay. 
Not tricking me because i am bad, but more because it uses knowledge it shouldnt have.
Rubberbanding, like in racers, or how i call it, artificial difficulty.

But ok, i had no problem to escape it and hide, even if it directly saw me i just had to run 10 metres to the next room and hide inside something, it wouldnt care enough to even keep wandering the same area for too long. 
Thats the problem of artificial difficulty, the AI isnt clever its just cheating.

Long story short, i ran around for like an hour without finding anything else than throwable stuff but clearly nothing i needed, so i called it a day and quit. Also refunded. 
I know an hour of gameplay is short, but even after that time i was bored and not thrilled to see whats next.
It wasnt frightening, no real horror, sound was bad besides the roaring of the monster, the "tempting" music when it chased me was annoying mostly and even so misdesigned that it prevented me from actually hearing anything useful.
Its also one of these classical "cheating" designs, where the music starts to go on as soon as the monster starts hunting the player, so he/she knows that its running-time. 
Just to stop when the monster gave up. 
As if i couldnt figure that out myself. This takes away what is left of the immersion, if i would dare to call it that.
 

Resumée:
A somewhat clever idea of Dead by Daylight Singleplayer, nice Monsterdesign and sometimes nice ambient sounds, packed with really outdated graphics, bad performance on a mid class PC (i checked im not the only one having issues there), basically boring gameplay that could be interesting if done better, a lack of modes and maps (1) and randomization that isnt really changing anything. 
Put some technical issues on top and it doesnt leave a good impression.

What i wish:
That they take this idea and their monsters. Pack more o ntop of that, more of each, include multiplayer options and a more clever AI for the monster and they had a great thing going on.
Sadly this wont happen and luckily for me and anyone else there is this company making Hello Neighbour which looks somewhat like what i wish Monstrum to be, just more comical looking and such.
If they manage some day to take this concept and make a horror-Hello Neighbour-like game with creepy monsters, im all in for that.
This isnt it.

33195810.review:
Покупать только на распродаже

[h1]Плюсы[/h1]

+ Атмосферно.
+ Не коридорчик, нужно что-то делать, несколько путей побега.
+ Можно победить монстра сбежав с корабля, или просто пшыкнуть в лицо с огнетушителя оглушив негодяя или завести в лужу бензина и поджечь, выведя его на некоторое время из строя.
+ Нету тупых скримеров, если ты боишься, то боишься самого присутствия монстра и испытываешь панику во время погони, пытаясь открыть трясущимися ручками дверь.
+ Мультиплатформа. Пользуюсь Линуксом, каждая нативная игра в копилку - большой плюс, так ещё и такого уровня, что не стыдно и на какую нибудь инди выставку с ней поехать.

[h1]Минусы[/h1]

- Короткая, за 10-12 часов можно победить всех монстров и выучить корабль наизусть(наверное потому, что я готовился перед боем с монстром и рисовал карту коробля).
- Плохо оптимизированная, при таком то графене фпс как в Battlefield 1, а еслы выкрутить на низкие то вместо текстурок мыло.
- "Кривые руки" пероснажа явно растут чуть выше, чем положено и когда, допустим, смотришь на пол, рука с фонариком не сгибается, как будто у персонажа сгибается только спина.
- Никаких следов жизни на корабле, одежды работников, следы крови в 2 местах на 6 палубе и в роде бы на 5, да и те маленькие, как будто кровь из носа пошла. Выглядит как будто все обнаружили монстра и уплыли с корабля, забрав все свои вещи (кроме кружек, лол).
- Сюжет чтоб был, какие то записки, "ТАЙНЫЙ ГРУЗ, КОТОРОГО НЕ БЫЛО В СПИСКЕ ЗАГРУЖАЕМЫХ НА БОРТ" и про пропажу людей.
- Монстры тупят, охотник после того, как погорит в бензине "бежит в страхе" со скоростью моей бабули, я даже перед ним становился пару раз, а он с такой же вальяжной походкой шёл к вентиляции и скрылся зализывать раны. А ещё в первую игру против призрака не понял, что я перед собой вижу, ибо со спины выглядит как чёрное с прожилками фиолетового облако, он меня заметил только когда я обошёл его и собственно увидел его мордаху.
- Монстры не графонистые, кроме громилы, он более менее. Охотник - прозрачачный дрыщ с открывающимся в 3 стороны ртом, призрак похож на прозрачного элементаля воды из WoW(Legion)  в тёмном облаке и со "страшным" лицом.
~ Слишком светло для дрейфующего в море корабля с не работающим двигателем. (Везде на верхних палубах освещение как на 3 скриншоте).
- Боишься не то, что тебя съест монстр, а то, что тебе придётся заново начинать игру.

[h1]Итог[/h1]
Монстры не страшные, корабль атмосферный, но пустоватый и маленький, игра короткая, но хотя бы имеет пути развития событий, не оптимизированная, сюжета нет. Своих 3 долларов явно стоит, не более.

33182409.review:
I've played quite a few horror games, and they do, at first, make me fearful and cautious. But after a while, i tend to get too used to them.

The Monstrum is different, though.

I've never felt more fearful or cautious while playing a horror game before. Nowhere on the ship is safe, you don't know which monster is on the prowl until you and them cross paths, and the ambiance always made me feel unsettled and kept me on edge.

This is a game i'd definitely recommend to any fans of the horror genre, as this game still holds up so well. A truly frightening experience that'll draw yu back in for another go, even if you play it once every few days. You feel like you can beat it, but this game will definitely test you to see if you can conquer it.

P.S this game almost made me develop Naviphobia (The fear of ships, vessels and boats.)

33071849.review:
This is a fun horror game where you never get to feel comfortable or safe, like you've mastered the game and it can no longer threaten you. Because the layout of the ship is randomized every time, you can't just learn the map by heart and speedrun your way to victory. And because there's no saving, not even a Save And Exit, you're always under pressure.

I haven't managed to escape once so far in 5 hours of play, but I'm having a blast.

33044161.review:
It's a bit like Alien: Isolation-lite in that there's an unkillable beast chasing you down, but the catch is that it is one of three potential baddies. It will take a variable amount of time in the game to realize just which one is hunting you down, but once you do it's all about minimizing the evidence of your presence and strategizing how you can either corral the monster or escape it. Each of the stalkers feel fresh and behave in ways that require different movements to address; straight-up outrunning may work for one, but others are built to counteract it.

The biggest downside is that there's only one level—a cargo ship. While this means the environment is somewhat limited in visual diversity, it makes up for it with the fact that each part of the ship has different 'natural' hazards that can mess you up in a chase or kill you if you're not lucky. Adding to the variety, there are three different escapes, each with a different set of required items. Placement of these (and other) items are randomized, which theoretically means that an easy escape once may be more difficult next time; I feel this is better in theory than in practice, since (for me) the helicopter is the surest way to flee. After your first escape, dedicate yourself to a different one and you should have a pretty good time.

If you are looking for a consistent challenge, this may not be the game for you. But if you want to take your time and explore the environment while being hunted by something sinister, I would recommend this.

32960683.review:
I had high hopes for this game, but... ehh.

Cramped room-and-corridor environments (which one would expect on a ship... so I'd have chosen an environment other than a ship), more of a "theme" than an "atmosphere" to this game (scary things are happening, but the game doesn't really convince me of it with much more than throwing monsters at me in dark places), no immersive storyline (there are little notes with "Fred and I are going to the starboard life raft so we can escape" and the like on them)...

I love procedurally generated content, and I love a well-crafted horror game. This is, technically, a horror game that features procedural content, but it feels more like a maze game where one of three monster tropes chases you down and kills you because every door you try to close behind you is determined to grab you and push you back where you came from.

I hate to say I didn't like it. The idea is perfect. Plus, it's got good art assets, I encountered no bugs (unless constantly closing doors on myself when I'd walked all the way through them counts as a "bug" - I think that's more of an unusually unforgiving door physics implementation), and I'd probably have been proud to be on the dev team if I'm honest.

Just wasn't half as entertaining as I'd expected. Got old quickly. I did get it for about $5, so that's nice, but... I could just as easily have gone on without spending that money. There are probably ways to improve this title, but it just gets little "birthday" hotfixes and the devs seem to have moved on to greener pastures.

32638488.review: If you combined in a sense, Alien with Titanic. Then you get this memorable scary-as-hell video game called Monstrum. And you have to find a way to survive and escape the ship of horrors. I thought this game would be easy but trust me these monsters aren't dummies, you have to learn their patterns and listen out for warning signs because if you make one mistake then it will end badly. 32265722.review:
Monstrum is quite possibly the tensest game I have ever played. The location, atmosphere, sounds, and having to finish the current run in one sitting - it is impossible to save progress, even when exiting the game - make it a genuinely terrifying experience.

One criticism I have about gameplay is that the monsters are always aware of which area of the ship you are in. The brute, for instance, could be stomping about in the engine room. Even if it never notices you, it will show up a couple of minutes after you sneak all the way to the other end of the huge cargo ship. I suppose this adds to the tension, but it also adds to the already considerable difficulty.

Despite the difficulty, the objective seems just attainable enough that there is always that urge to play one more run.

Overall, I would highly recommend this game to horror fans. In my opinion, Monstrum is one of the best examples of the genre.

Also, the Linux version works perfectly on my machine, even though I am not running Ubuntu. So, a great big thanks to the dev team for releasing a completely functional Linux version.

32088300.review:
This game is pretty much the perfect horror/suspense/thriller-type game for me. Although intense at times, the monsters are not scary enough that they make scare-quit the game. Rather, when I'm caught, I get more upset, disappointed or angry. Point being, I don't usually play horror games. In fact, I tend to stay away from the whole genre in general, both games and movies, as I don't enjoy the anxiety generated from them. But this game is perfect in the sense that it gets my heart going, is very exciting, but doesn't push me over the edge.

I would recommend this game to anyone who has similar issues - likes to play horror games, but just can't take the jump scares and heart beating out of their chest. Usually when the chase is up and you're caught, you'll know it, and you'll accept your death, which is generally mild and easy to take.

Also, I've played maybe 40 or 50 runs now, and although I've come close, I have not yet been able to escape the ship. My time is coming though. So replayability is also a great factor in this game, especially since the ships are random generated and never the same twice. General layouts are the same, but sometimes you'll need to zig where in the last game you zagged.

So, in summary, if you like horror games but have been too afraid in dive into the genre, try this one on for size. My anxiety is never spiked to the point of discomfort, and it's a lot of fun trying to a) find the pieces needed to escape and b) keep whatever is chasing you 50 steps behind. If you're hardcore into jumpscares, thrillers and horrors, you'll likely end up laughing at this game being labelled a "horror", and you might want to find something a little more intense.

I, however, will enjoy this game for many hours to come. I recommend similar-like people as myself do the same.

32037210.review:
Ahh, Monstrum. Has been a long time my darling! How have you bee- *dies*

Monstrum is a very peculiar horror game. It has a unique setting, interesting and terrifying Monsters, and some hilarious bugs and glitches to expl- wait, oh fuck, they fixed those. Shit 

[h1] What is Monstrum? [/h1]

Monstrum is an indie horror game. It follows the player waking up in a very cramped room on either the upper decks or the lower decks of an abandoned cargo ship. You must find the equipment required to repair one of the three escape routes and get off the ship. There's just one problem. You're not alone. 

[h1] Graphics and Sounds [/h1]

Monstrum is a nice enough looking game. The graphics, while dated, keep the atmosphere very tense. The ship has clearly seen some action, and there is a fair amount of wear around it. Rust, mould, and other forms of age really hammer home that good old horror feel. It sets the premise right up for a good old scare-fest. The graphics don't have many options to go with them though, and if you want to really run them well you'll need a fairly tanky PC. It's nowhere near as demanding as other horror games, but you'll still need a fairly stable rig.

For any horror game to be good, it needs, NEEDS, to have good sound design. Thankfully for Monstrum, the sound is pretty damn great. The creaking of the ship, the gentle lull of the waves lapping against the hull, the sound of your face being devoured by a Xenomorph-esque entity, they all sound very high quality. But they are also damn near essential if you want to survive in this game for more than 5 minutes. Listening out for a monster is the best way to prepare for it. And of course, it lets you have a much nicer experience when the music of a predator plays and you know you've got to vacate the area now. 

[h1] The Gameplay [/h1]

So, how does Monstrum play out? Well, the game throws you into a small room with a flashlight, a fuse, and a lighter/glow stick. There is also a random Monster which will give you company on your gameplay journey. We'll get to those in a moment. You have to try and escape the ship by collecting items to repair/refuel either a life raft, a helicopter, or a submarine. You need to find these items scattered across the ship and get away ASAP. If you die, you die. You lose all your stuff, all your progress, and are sent back to the beginning. Which isn't all that bad, until you notice that the ships layout has been changed and there is a different monster on board. 

[h1] The Monsters [/h1]

There are three monsters (as of this time, there are however stories of a fourth one being added sometime), which are the following;

[b] The Brute [/b]

The 'mascot' of Monstrum. This dude is big, fast, and very, very strong. Like a Charger from Left4Dead, this thing will stomp around the ship searching for you. However, he's very heavy, so his footsteps are extremely audible, and he is also remarkably stupid. Oh yeah, and his face is also a torch, emitting a nice little orange glow in front of him wherever he goes. 

[b] The Hunter [/b]

The knock off Xenomorph. Ok, not really, but they are fairly similar in both appearance and behaviour. She (yes, its a she) likes to climb through vents and scare the shit out of you the second you make any noise near vents. It also seems to be very wet all of the time, making squishy footsteps wherever it goes. Oh yeah, it can also 'lay' these egg sacks that it can crawl out of the second you walk past them. On the bright side, she is very slow and weak to almost every form of self-defence in the game!

[b] The Fiend [/b]

Fuck this thing. Just, fuck it. This piece of sh- ok, I'll calm down. This 'monster' is more of an alien to me. It loves to mess with electricity, specifically the lights, causing them to flicker when it's nearby and stop working completely when it's next to them. Oh yeah, it also levitates. And it has telekinetic powers which can shut nearby doors and give you nosebleeds. And since it levitates, it doesn't make any footstep noise. Arguably the most difficult monster to deal with, this creature will make you flip your shit when it kills you for the 5th time. 

[h1] Glitches and Bugs [/h1]

Look up Monstrum funny moments on Youtube and most of the videos will involve exploiting glitches and bugs. While the most recent update removed most of these, some are still present. While hilarious at times, these can ruin the mood of the game at times. If you spot a bug, make sure to report it to the forums. Though judging by the update rate of this game, it'll probably be fixed in about a year or so. 

[h1] The Problems (like, gameplay-wise) [/h1]

The game doesn't remain scary for all that long. More than anything, it gets very annoying and frustrating at times. Being killed over and over can really ruin the feel of the game. It becomes more of a chore, and eventually you might just give up. Also, while the randomized maps and different monsters add a fair amount of replay ability, it will eventually become boring. After I got all the achievements and beat the game around 20 times, it just got really dull. I quit for a year or two and I'm deciding to give it another shot. 

Another problem with the game is that the monsters have a homing beacon on you. They will always, ALWAYS, be in the same area as you. Even if you leave them at one end of the ship, they'll be within a corridors distance of you in about 3 minutes. It's not a game of Cat and Mouse, it's a game of 'collect some shit and fuck off before they show up'. While this can appeal to some people, it can also really put off some others. 

[h1] The Verdict [/h1]

Monstrum is an immersive game that will scare the shit out of you. It provides some interesting elements and is a breath of fresh air to the horror game genre. While it's old, it is still really fun. However, it does have some issues which hold it back from being brilliant. 

The sound is great, pulling the player into the world and really immersing them into the game. The graphics, while not great, still help drive home the feeling of horror on board this (almost empty) ship. 

However, after a while, the game can get rather dull, and a rather inactive group of developers means updates are few and very, very far between. 

Overall, this is a nice little game that will provide you with some scares and fun. Thus, I give it a positive review and a score of 7.8/10

Главному герою приходится выживать в многоэтажном корабле, на котором, всегда где-то рядом, разгуливает монстр. 12 "индюшек" из 10!

31850872.review: I saw Markiplier and DashieGames play this game and I knew that this game would be worth playing, so I bought it to see what it was like for myself. This game is so terrifying, that I feel constant apprehension about moving forward in the game, even though I know I need to in order to complete it! The sounds really add to the atmosphere and the monsters themselves are literally nightmare fueI! It just goes to show that Team Junkfish have done an awesome job at making this game terrifying! What makes the game even scarier is the fact that you don't know what monster your're facing up against, until it's too late! (especailly if it's 'The Hunter' or 'The Fiend'. 'The Brute' is easy to spot, what with its loud footsteps and the light emitting from its face) Add to the fact that the map is randomly generated each time you play, (including the fact that most of the items are randomly spawned on the map with each replay) and you will have an awesome horror game experience!  I always feel a constant feeling of dread whilst playing! I highly recommend you buy this game! For the asking price (whether it is on sale or it is at normal price), it is way worth the purchase! Thank you Team Junkfish for such an amazing and refreshing horror game experience!

31829303.review:
Summary:
All things considered, monstrum is a better than average indie horror game at an indie horror game's price. The monsters are interesting, the collectable and RNG systems bring about a fair amount of replayability to the game, and the general feel of the game are superb. Though it is obvious that this product has recieved a vast amount of care from the developers, bugs still remain. These bugs aren't exactly the most common, or the most game breaking, but in certain situations it can lead to a bit of headache or confusion. All in all, the game is worth the price in my eyes, and it'll certainly grant satisfactory hours of entertainment in the time that one plays it.

The Great:
The different monsters provide a new experience through progressive playthroughs, lending to the initial anxiety of a new game. Until which monster the player gets during their playthrough is discovered, the player will have to act in a more cautious manner to determine how to move forward. That being said, the different monsters forces players to adapt a new playstyle dependent on the monster they encounter. This, coupled with the fact the the ship's interior is filled with darkness and a general sense of claustrophobia, helps bring about the fear of being followed or hunted with no where to run. Without a doubt, the best parts of this game for me were the ship's ambience and how it is important to observe the monsters in order to properly combat them.

The Good:
The game itself runs on the idea that one must find particular items in order to make their way off the ship. All the while, the player will have to constantly keep their eyes and ears open for any signs of an encroaching monster. This is a pretty basic concept within this genre of horror games, and considering the setting in which the player is forced into; it can lead to scenarios that test a player's resolve, patience and stamina whilst under pressure. The collectible system within the game brings about some aspects as to what is actually going on within the ship that the game takes place and adds a nice layer of backstory to the experience. Along with the RNG spawning system for items across a semi procedurally generated ship provides a relatively new experience altogether without devaluing what is learned from previous playthroughs.

The Bad:
The game itself has quite a few bugs, a couple of which go as follows: The hunter has a knack for getting herself caught behind map geometry or objects within the map which subsequently bug her ai giving the player free roam of the ship. Certain items in the game, such as the flare gun, are sometimes impossible to find due to the object spawning in an impossible location. The fiend is liable to spawn in powered off rooms, leading to the player having free roam around the ship. The monsters will occasionally outright ignore sound cues brought on by a player setting up a radio in a room or a dinner bell going off in favor of seeking out a player that has not made their location known yet.
Another downside is that after a certain point in gametime, a player will be much more aware to how the AI work, making certain monsters like the hunter, exceedingly easy to deal with. 

Suggestions for future updates/Next game:
After a certain point, I think it would be a good idea for player to have an unlock system such as the ability to designate which monster the player wants to face after they have successfully escaped after encountering that monster. As person who extensively enjoyed this game, I'd like the chance to choose what I have to deal with after I had to go through the process of learning each monster's patterns and getting away from them. I'd also like to see a cheat mode of sorts for players who have 100%'ed the game. I know I havent gotten that flare gun achievement yet, and I intend on doing so, but I think monstrum would be improved if players who have played the game for an extensive amount should be given the option to enter noclip or open a console of sorts. This console could also lessen the strain on finding items that may be bugged in game. It would also be nice if there was a challenge system of sorts within the game, allowing one to spawn more than one monster at the start of a game. I know that after spending a decent amount of time watching the monster's movements and how exactly to counter them, I'd like to see either something new or for a difficulty increase of some kind.

31611713.review:
Monstrum... j'ai profité de soldes à -75% pour l'acheter bien qu'à 15€ le jeu restre à un prix des plus convenable. Monstrum est un très bon jeu d'horreur au niveau de l'ambiance (oppressante). Cette ambiance est notamment permise grâce au côté rogue-like du jeu qui rend les parties des plus imprévisibles. Donc, on joue un personnage dont on ne connait ni le nom ni vraiment son identité, on doit s'échapper d'un navire où se trouvent des monstres (3 mais seulement 1 aléatoirement choisis par partie). Les monstres ont une I.A plus ou moins développée et ont surtout des caractéristiques qui leurs sont propres et qui oblige le joueur à adapter son style de jeu en fonction du monstre se trouvant dans sa partie.

Monstrum est donc un jeu que je conseille, malheuresement sa durée de vie n'est pas assez longue même en essayant de compléter les succès et en s'amusant à faire quelques speedruns. Ceci est dû à une histoire absente du jeu et c'est vraiment dommage car il y a matière à faire ! Après il y a le traditionnelle manque de contenu, on découvre vite tout les items et pièces du navire présents dans le jeu mais je pardonne ce défaut car c'est un jeu indépendant.

Monstrum n'accueille désormais depuis un certain temps plus aucunes mises à jour de contenus et c'est franchement dommage.

31584832.review:
[h1]Ausgezeichnetes Survial Horror-Game[/h1]

Um das von vorne herein zu sagen, eigentlich ist Survival Horror alles andere als mein favorisiertes Genre. Aber ich habe das Spiel in einem "Let's Play" gesehen, woraufhin ich es selbst spielen musste. Und ich kann nur sagen: [i]Monstrum[/i] ist ein großartiges Spiel, dass wirklich Spaß macht!
Besonders faszinierend ist das Setting das Spiels: Ein in dunkler Nacht über einen namenlosen Ozean treibendes einsames Containerschiff. Dieses Schiff ist liebevoll detailliert gestaltet und durch die zufällig generierte Anordnung von Räumen ein schauriger Irrgarten, dass man trotzdem gerne erkundet. Auch die drei Gegner, von deinen einer zufällig auf der Map spawnt, sind absolut furchteinflößend und alle auf ihre eigene Art und Weise unangenehm. Mein persönlicher Favorit ist aber "the Brute", dessen laut stapfende Schritte durch das halbe Schiff zu hören sind und selbst das mutigste Gamer Herz ein ganzes Stück schneller schlagen lassen.
Die Flucht vom Schiff will wohl überlegt sein und ist durch die zufällige Verteilung aller notwendigen Materialien und Werkzeuge eine nervenaufreibende Angelegenheit und darüber hinaus auch eine ziemliche Herausforderung. Wer es schafft das Schiff lebend zu verlassen hat sich meinen Respekt verdient.
Eine klare Empfehlung von mir und ein großes Lob an die Indi-Entwickler!

30971247.review:
*I have not played the game with VR*

I bought Monstrum because multiple reviews said it compared to Alien: Isolation.

Unfortunately, I don't agree.

While playing A:I, I was under constant stress and was genuinely terrified of the Xenomorph. In Monstrum, I just... can't get in to it. Avoiding the monsters is annoying instead of frightening. Running around looking for the items feels more like a chore instead of giving me the impression I need to escape impending doom.

The game isn't terrible, but I haven't been able to achieve an emotional (fear) attachment to the game like with A:I. For this reason, I am unable to recommend the game, if that's the type of experience you're seeking. However, I'm not done playing it and I will update my review if my feelings change.

Помню тот день,когда Monstrum был еще в раннем доступе,и я хотел в него поиграть,очень сильно хотел.
Когда настал день покупки,то я был на 7 месте от счастья.
Установив игру,выключив свет,заперев дверь в мою комнату,я начла играть.
Первые 10 минут я осторожно исследовал корабль,боялся наткнуться на монстров,более менее успоковшись стал собирать предметы,нашел вертолет!
Ходил еще минут 20,никого не замечал."Изи катка"подумал я,а самое главное,что в это же мгновения я открыл дверь,а там стоял огромный монстр,которого игра обозвала "Брут",поставив на паузу игру я побледнел.Как же я тогда обосрался!

30686905.review:
Monstrum é uma experiência de terror psicológico com perspectiva em primeira pessoa ao velho estilo pique esconde com o diabo. Tudo se passa dentro de um navio a deriva em alto mar, e o jogador tem o único e simples objetivo de escapar. Porém, não tão simples quanto parece, obviamente. Durante a jogatina você descobrirá que existem mais de uma forma de escapar, mas para isso, você precisará resolver determinados problemas antes. E claro, ficar vivo, pois em algum lugar do navio, uma criatura indeterminada, indefinida e inexplicável está a sua espreita.

A criatura, ou, fazendo jus ao nome do jogo, o Monstrum, na verdade não está ciente da presença do humano (você) no navio, o que dá uma vantagem inicial ao jogador em seus primeiros passos. Porém, em determinado momento, por algum motivo bastante bizarro, a criatura descobre onde você está, e é aí que as coisas esquentam. Pois a partir do momento que você é descoberto pela primeira vez, a criatura simplesmente não sairá do seu raio de visão, e jogar com o fone de ouvido nas alturas é o mais recomendado para sobreviver. E foi exatamente aí que este jogo me impressionou.

Obviamente eu morri antes mesmo de descobrir o que estava acontecendo, mas antes de morrer, tive um breve vislumbre do Monstrum. Pouco antes de me deparar com a criatura, ela havia feito sons bizarros pelos corredores metálicos do navio, me dando dicas de sua presença e aproximação. E pelo som que ela produzia, eu podia dizer onde estava e se ela estava no meu encalço ou apenas perambulando. Garanto que o susto que levei valeu cada centavo que investi no jogo (comprei em uma promoção, aconselho fazer o mesmo). Até aí, tudo ótimo, resolvi tentar novamente. Mas para minha surpresa, como você já deve imaginar, o som do Monstrum havia mudado para algo mais bizarro e fantasmagórico. Isso mesmo amigos, existia outra criatura, completamente diferente da anterior. Comportamento diferente, movimentação diferente, sons diferente e visual diferente. Apenas descobri do que se tratava, quando morri.

Descobri até então 3 criaturas diferentes, eu gostaria muito de comentar sobre cada uma delas, porque realmente é a melhor coisa neste jogo, mas o prazer de descobrir por si só é algo fantástico que não quero tirar de vocês. Talvez existam outras, não sei, e se alguém descobriu mais alguma, pode comentar por aqui mesmo.

Durante o jogo, fragmentos da história são encontrados através de cartas, diários e relatos, mas tirando isso, é tudo uma questão de correr contra o tempo, se esconder e não fazer barulho para não ser descoberto. O visual do jogo é equilibrado entre o grosseiro e o detalhista. E o clima sem som aumenta as expectativas sobre o Monstrum, deixando o jogo mais tenso a cada passo.

Infelizmente eu achei a ideia principal bastante simples, me desempolgou um pouco. E depois de morrer alguma dezena de vezes por motivo nenhum, acabei cansando do jogo, mas as primeiras tentativas foram incríveis. Se você gosta de terror, compre. Mas espere por uma promoção.

Monstrum  - 6/10

30650595.review: Хммм... Монструм? В первый раз увидел эту игру у Артура Блэка, через год появилось желание самому поиграть. Игра сама себе играется, ннооо везде есть свои минусы, чёрт их подери: оптимизация, баги, удивительные монстры, которые находят тебя, даже если ты встретил его на мостике(причём он тебя, ну, пусть будет Брут, не заметил и характерной музыки не наблюдалось), посмотрел ему нагло в спину, пошёл вниз в машинное отделение поискать там цепь для спуска на воду шлюпки, закрыл на защелку все двери в машинном, спустился на нижний этаж - и тут ты слышишь его топот. Об этом уже много кто написал, но я считаю эту недолелку её(то есть игры) особенностью. Это , с одной стороны, и раздражает, но бл*ять, это ж ведь о**енно, сколько нервов, убежать от монстра очень далеко все равно не получится, и это, как мне кажется, в своей мере можно считать особенностью.
