24706942.review:
First off, take a look at the majority of positive reviews for this game. A large percentage of them are made by people ~2 hours or less of gameplay. Then half of those are just people saying "monster popped up. Great game". That should tell you something about this game right off the bat. [b] People get bored of it really fast. [/b]

The game's concept is not bad, on paper. You're trapped on a ship with a monster. Escape. But it's just so poorly executed it's not worth the $18 price tag.

I came directly from playing Alien Isolation and the controls just feel clunky and cumbersome, even compared to other indie titles like Outlast and Amnesia the controls still feel clunky. None of it really feels smooth, especially crouching and leaning. This negates the stealth option and just makes the cop out to run everywhere.

The story for this game is just poor. It's really the main reason why I can't recommend this game because it kills the games replayability and incentive to [b] actually play. [/b] After discovering all 21 notes it's a disappointment. The story you discover is weak and doesn't motivate you to keep playing like the story in a game should. 

This brings me to the permadeath system. The implementation just feels like a cop out so they didn't have to write a compelling story.  It seems like the only reason it was implemented was so people would invest the 12+ hours normally associated with a game, since this is an extremely bare bones game. The permadeath also killed replayability for me. I didn't really feel like trying to beat this game after an hour. There's no motivation to do anything with the lack of story.  It's just escape.  The game feels like a shell of a game. If you beat this game you definitely won't be playing it again. This is one of those games like FNaF. You break it out when you're with friends. See who can last the longest, like in GTA when you see who can go on the run from the cops the longest.

This game is not worth its price tag for what you get. If there were more levels to play it might be worth it. And honestly the developers should consider doing that because the story that ties the monsters to the ship is weak. The way the game is designed and plays feels like you should have the option of 4-5 maps to choose from. Rather than being tied to one "randomized map". (It's not as randomized as the developers make you think. Everything stays the same except for what items appear in each room. The map stays the same except for how the hallways twist in some of the deck areas.)  This game is just a late bandwagon game to the Amnesia/Outlast/Alien Isolation train.  But there's just so little content it's not worth the price tage.  Developer's should consider making it like the first Amnesia, implementing a modding system so people can upload different maps.  That way at least someone who cares about making a game could give a map with a decent story to uncover that would actually make me want to play it.

24703486.review:
Version horreur du jeu du chat et de la souris. Ambiance "rouille", oppression et malaise garantis.
Vous vous réveillez sur un grand bateau cargo qui craque de partout (dont une bonne partie est générée aléatoirement à chaque tentative : placement et type des salles, dispersion des objets, secteurs bloqués) et, par des notes disseminées ça-et-là sur le cargo, vous apprendrez un peu ce qui se trame.

Le but du jeu est de quitter le vaisseau par un moyen ou un autre en l'explorant et en récupérant du matériel.
Mais vous n'êtes pas seul sur le bateau et à chaque partie un monstre - choisi aléatoirement parmi 3 très différents et vraiment pas beaux du tout - vous cherchera sans relâche et c'est là la force du jeu. Bien qu'il arrive de temps en temps à l'I.A de patauger (perso j'ai préféré de peu l'I.A. de l'alien dans Alien Isolation), le joueur est constamment sous pression ; le moindre faux-pas (au sens propre comme au figuré) attirera l'attention du monstre sur lui. Et vous allez soupirer d'angoisse et d'appréhension quand vous vous rendrez compte, après avoir fouillé l'entiereté des quartiers de l'équipage, du messe, du pont et même de la zone de stockage, que la super-pince-coupe-boulons qui vous manque se trouve - dans ce "run" - au fin fond de la salle des machines, à l'autre bout du cargo, zone peu éclairée, atmosphère étouffante, couloirs étroits et n'offrant que peu de voies de retraite !

Il faut constamment être aux aguets pour deviner où se trouve le monstre, préparer une route de retraite en cas de confrontation - ouvrir un placard dans la salle adjacente, générer du bruit pour leurrer le vilain (ici pas question d'affronter le monstre, on ne peut que fuir, même si quelques objets permettent d'opposer une maigre résistance et de gagner de précieuses secondes pour se cacher, la confrontation est toujours synonyme de gros ennuis)

Techniquement le jeu n'est pas folichon mais il fait le boulot et est plutôt bien optimisé (tourne à ~30FPS en medium, basse résolution sur GPU intégré Intel HD 520) et c'est surtout la direction artistique qui m'a plue et qui pour moi occulte quasi totalement la partie technique, il faut le dire, un peu dépassée. La partie sonore n'est pas en reste, la précision dans la localisation des sons permet de deviner les déplacements des monstres...ou pas dans certains cas (no spoil ;-) ) 

La plus grande force de ce jeu à mon avis et ce qui change de la majorité des autre jeux d'horreurs à la sauce scripts, jumpscares et j'en passe : c'est l'aléatoire couplé à l'I.A. peu prédictible du monstre qui offre une grande rejouabilité et empêche le jeu de tomber dans le classique die and retry pour chaque script de chaque corridor.

Si vous avez aimé camper dans un casier durant la moitié de votre temps de jeu sur Alien Isolation, que vous appréciez fuir dans des couloirs exigus inconnus avec un monstre aux trousses et une horrible musique ou que vous voulez simplement tenter l'expérience d'un jeu d'horreur oppressant, stressant mais ô combien fun et gratifiant, Monstrum est fait pour vous et vous occupera un bon moment. Il vaut son prix, soldé il est presque donné. Et en plus c'est un jeu indé !

24686105.review:
WHEW! After finally beating monstrum, and playing for 27 hours, I have to say, WHAT A RUSH! To start, the ship being procedurally generated is both exciting, and sometimes frustrating, but, it's convinced me to go back and try and beat it again. The ship is pretty confined on some decks, so having exit strategies for certain areas is a must.

    Part of Monstrum is just dumb luck really. Some play throughs, you'll be scrounging for 15-20 min and come up short on items, others you'll find everything to escape in that amount of time. The 3 monsters are all frightening in their own way, was that light flickering because it's a POS? Or is the fiend near by? 

   Is that the sound of waves slapping the hull, or is the hunter around? Is the brute above me or below, or on the same deck?!?!? These questions and more besides are all frightening to have in your head. The game felt mostly fair as far as the AI goes, there were some occasions where the monster (mostly the brute tbh) would almost shadow me around the ship, yet, didn't actually know where I was. It's not an easy game, but it's very rewarding! having everything come together for your escape is extremly satisfying, but that's only part of it.

    There are 3 methods of escape, each with pros and cons, The raft, while having fewer pre-requisites to gather up, is exposed, and harder to escape from, and the items seem harder to find, barring the tape. The sub is a good choice, it's at the very bottom deck, so it's easier to tell where the monster is, and with multiple exits, easier to escape. The chopper is a good choice, because it gives you built in defense, with controllable steam vents to ward off the monster with. Yet, requires a good bit of setup.

      The sounds are another huge plus, every monster is CREEPY to hear scuttling (or stomping/floating) around, and when they've suddenly spotted you, and shrieked in anger, it's pulse pounding, and is a huge adrenaline rush. The ship creaks, and groans, sometimes obscuring the sounds of the monster, making it that much more immersive.

    Opening doors is a startling affair, being old ship doors they are loud, which works for you too, when the monster is looking for you. All in all, from the sounds, atmosphere, AI, and overall polish, Monstrum is an AMAZING survival horror game!
                                                                                  9/10

Read some of the reviews where people said they were scared s**tless and all that.  I didn't believe them, boy was I wrong.

I spawned in a random room, found a flashlight.  A few minutes later, my flashlight goes dark and I have no idea where I am, I wander into some room with what looks like a security station with monitors.  I hear footsteps and look out the window in the door and see something walking up to the door, but I didn't wait to find out what it was.  I hide for a minute and come out and it went away.  After quickly finding another flashlight and a fire extinguisher, I keep moving.

I keep moving through the structure and I hear a loud sound behind me.  I quickly turn around to see a pipe burst, no big deal.  I then come to some stairs.  Go up?  Go down?  Since I am an idiot, I went down hoping to find loots.  

I walk into a room with glowing things.  I turn on my flashlight to see what they were, EGG SACKS!  uh egg sacks?  (This is the part in every horror movie that you yell at the screen, "GTFO!"). Well I didn't listen to the little but loud voice in my head and I walked up to them.  

I begin to hear this loud squishing sound and something jumps out at me.  I literally jumped 3 feet in the air and broke the keyboard tray on my desk by my knees slamming into it.  I don't know what I expected.  I managed to hit the escape key and paused it before I assumed I would be killed.  I regained my composure after screaming like a little girl and hit the escape button again.  Quickly I used the fire extinguisher and shot it at whatever was coming at me.  

THEN I F**KING RAN, I RAN LIKE F**KING HELL!  I had no idea where I was going but I ran into a big room with lots of machines.  An engine room?  Now I was sure I was on a ship.  I found a phone and tried to dial 911 (yes, I did that).

No power though, I need to find a power source I said to myself.  I did find a welding kit, a potential weapon maybe?  If I have to kill it, I WILL KILL IT WITH FIRE.

I walked out of the room with the phone and went down another level.  I found a couple of more rooms with phones, one was locked.  I then hear a growlish roar and squishy footsteps coming down the stairs behind me.  I tried to grab my fire extinguisher but it was empty, then I tried the welding torch...

24643757.review:
If you're a fan of horror games (and why would you be looking at this game if you weren't), then this is a must-play.  
    At it's core, Monstrum is a hide-and-seek survival horror game where you must explore a (mostly) randomly generated cargo ship in search of various items needed to help you escape from the ship via one of three potential routes.  The basic layout of the ship is always the same, but the rooms and item locations change each playthrough, ensuring that each attempt to escape is unique.  
    Oh, and you're also being hunted by one of three potential horrifying monsters each time.  Not sure if I mentioned that yet.  Each monster has its own style of pursuit, and whether it is the Brute's thunderous and relentless juggernaut-style chases, the Hunter's stealth and trap-based ambush game, or the Fiend's paranoia inducing methodical sweeps of your potential hiding spots, you're guaranteed to spend more time cowering inside of a cabinet than you ever thought possible in a video game.  
    On top of being genuinely dread-inducing, the game is a true challenge to beat, and the sense of reward upon completing your first successful run-through is tremendous.  I can honestly say I had several heart-pounding experiences with this game, and the variety it offers between it's random pairing of monster/layout/item location will keep you coming back over and over again.  I played this game well past my 100% achievement completion, and look forward to playing it again after some time off and experiencing the thrill and terror all over again.  I picked up the game on sale, but highly recommend it even at full price.

24498284.review:
2016.08.14   全成就达成！更新一下评测~当攻略比较好：
带图攻略：http://steamcn.com/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=211089&page=1&extra=#pid3074942
整个船分为三个大块，船尾蒸汽工具区、船中通道区和船头住宅区，其中船尾1层为潜水艇通关（保险丝、潜水艇头灯、焊接工具和电池），二三层有大量房间，很大几率刷物品；船中通道区为大量破烂集装箱，刷物品几率很低，船中的顶层为直升机通关（钥匙、钳子、两桶油）；船头住宅区分为四层，5，6有大量小房间，散布各种通关道具，七层有一个保安室大几率刷道具，和船外救生筏通关（胶带、气筒、铁链），放下救生筏后去五层通关；八层有舰桥，三层有蒸汽阀门总开关室，船头是最复杂的一片区域，也是道具刷的最多的区域。

三种怪，熔岩（个大，走路声音极其明显，难度适中）；水怪（在管道中传来传去，智商低，速度慢，难度最简单）；巫妖（锁门，远程控制，出现影响灯光，难度最难），其实熟悉地图后，除了注意别跑到个别死胡同里，基本全程shift跑路即可通关。

这个游戏难度不高，全成就也很简单，三种怪，三种通关方式6个成就，被三种怪各杀死一次（很简单）；隐藏成就：拿6个荧光棒、用灭火器喷怪、信号弹喷怪、从软泥堆里用道具引出水怪、一局中用两个保险丝开门、用收音机或者定时器吸引怪物破坏一个栅栏门、被陷阱绊倒后被怪物杀死；最难的两个成就：用保险丝打开铁门后，用收音机吸引怪物进门，然后关门，关保险丝开关困住怪物一个；在船头三层的蒸汽室里，用保险丝开通蒸汽室电源，然后通过打电话（按2键）将怪物吸引过去将最底层不能打破的门撞开，然后进入该房间将总阀门关掉。

总之，这款15年最棒的小品恐怖游戏，值得一玩，对于成就疑惑者可以留言哈~

24436300.review:
Three monsters:
1======Little Pig :It will appear in any place where you are.
2======Big Pig:There is a sensitive sense of smell, according to a route you have props, you appear in that line on the block.
3======Purple witch:Have remote control ability, the most terrible enemy.

about:CHINESE  Please translate to see
1:俗称透明怪，出现的地点固定，主要是通风口和卵泡。通风口分为头顶的和侧边的，很常见，如果本次敌人是它，虽说它并不会像另外两个敌人那样巡逻，不过应该是无处不在的威胁。它的视力比较差，躲在关掉灯的屋里能有效降低被擒率（比如两个柜子，你躲进其中一个，它会掀开另外一个）。还有就是它的特性，它惧怕火焰，站起来时会怕二氧化碳（它在爬行时二氧化碳是无效的），算是最简单的敌人。尤其是潜水艇路线时带汽油和打火机，或者信号枪，可以直接击退它。

2：俗称岩浆怪，看到这个名字你就应该明白它是不怕火焰的，不过却会被二氧化碳干扰视线（飞机场那儿的蒸汽利用好也同样对它有奇效哦~你可以从没蒸汽的一端上去，然后转动控制杆，它追上的时候会被喷到，从而换另一头（另一头的意思是，它会绕远路从另一端的蒸汽过来，而不是左边走不通就走右边）过来，这时你就有足够的时间跑掉）。走路声音很响，辨识度高，【会踩陷阱】，被追时不要跑直线。潜水艇路线不要逃离控制室，它会砸掉潜水艇控制器。。。

3：俗称巫妖王，最强大的敌人，所到之处，电压为0。手电筒也不能用。自带“嗡嗡嗡”BGM的怪物，辨识度也很高，可以预知。它可以穿墙，远程控制（距离很远的话可以挣脱）。会被二氧化碳喷瞎，被它追也不要跑直线，多绕弯。

三种逃脱路线：
直升飞机：最简单的逃脱方式，需要【钳子，钥匙，两桶汽油】。过程中声响很大，需要躲藏。不过周围有很多可以隐匿的地方。

气垫船：比较容易的逃脱方式，大家可以从气垫船所在的开口那儿跳到门框上，不会摔死，可以快速逃跑。需要【胶带，打气筒，铁链】。过程中危险系数较小，通过我前面说的方法逃跑还是特别简单的。

潜水艇：最难的路线，需要【蓄电池，焊接工具，头灯，保险丝】如果遇到的是岩浆怪（Big pig），必须准备一些二氧化碳和它周旋，不能让它破坏机器。巫妖王的话，这个【潜水艇+巫妖王】的组合我还没遇到过，没什么对策。透明怪的话直接枪击（总共3发子弹）或者火烧。

小技巧：
1.蒸汽工作室内有一个蒸汽总开关，可以用电话把怪物勾引过去打开门。（电话拨打：2）
2.蒸汽工作室里可能会有以下东西：最多1个保险丝（最多1个，也可能1个都没有），至少1个汽油（至少1个，也有可能2-3个），最多1个钳子，至少1个铁链，最多1个打气筒，至少3个荧光棒，至少2个手电筒，至少5个易碎品，最多一个蓄电池，最多一个焊接工具，最多一个头灯。没见过胶带。
3.怪物会形影相随，不会离你太远，这是程序这么设计的，布置好火焰陷阱或者带着二氧化碳防身，多熟悉一些不变的地形（蒸汽控制室和有气垫船的甲板），利用地形周旋。
4.如果你丢个录音机到屋里，逃跑过程中被发现，那么怪物会优先追你，而不会去打开那个你丢了录音机的门。也就是说浪费了一个录音机。
5.如果你捡到背包，请善加利用。
6.一些不变的东西：出生点必然会有：手电筒，打火机或荧光棒，保险丝。
                                最上层也就是第五层（甲板是第四层），有一个摄像头和一个房间。
                                第四层至少会有3个房间。
                                第三层会比第四层多1-2个房间。
                                第二层会比第三层多1-2个房间或与第三层一样。
                                第一层与第二层同理。
                                地下1层和地下2层的变动比较大，或多或少会有一些房间。
                                蒸汽工作室在气垫船的最正下方。
7.蒸汽工作室怎么去：如前面所说，下到最底层，会看到有四条路线，当然有2条与另外2条是不一样的。注意观察一下，哪边看起来比较远，远的那个会有两个蒸汽阀，近的那个只有一个蒸汽阀，那么近的那条路就是蒸汽工作室。远的那条路是通往集装箱区的路，通过集装箱区会到达潜水艇附近。

24117833.review:
You wake up in the ship. Crew is missing. You have to escape - as it turns out - one of the three possible monsters by finding your way out of the ship. What happened? What are those monsters, where they come from? No matter. You can find pieces of journal that doesn't really answer any of those questions. The thing is : you are alone in the ship, you have to find some supplies so you can fly off with helicopter or escape with minisub. Nonetheless you got gigantic monstermagnet on your back and so they are homing to you. It doesn't matter how much you sneak or hide, they will find you. With sight, hear or smell - you don't know and moreover you can't do anything meaningfull (that would matter) to deceive them. They come and they will kill you. 

I would have hoped that there were atleast some sort of plot - story or something - that would have builded up psychological horror. That there would be something to learn about those monsters. Something that you could use to give you advantage. But no. First you hear noise, then you see monster, then it kills you, And because there is no real plot or story to unfold or no other survivors it just starts to feel repetive and pointless pretty soon.

23981014.review:
"Monstrum" ist ein kleines Indie-First-Person Horror Escape-Survival-Roguelike auf einer partiell prozedural generierten Schiffs-Map.

Wir sind allein. Auf einem Containerschiff. Auf dem offenen Meer. Es ist Nacht. Kein menschliches Wesen ist zu finden. Einer der Container ist aufgebrochen, die Seitenwand einfach aufgebogen. Was ist das? Ein Wesen, ein Monster war in dem Container, hat sich befreit und streift nun über die Decks des Schiffs. Es darf uns nicht finden. Wir müssen überleben und von diesem schwimmenden Grab entkommen.

"Monstrums" Hintergrund-Geschichte wird auf zu findenden Zetteln erzählt, ist nette Dreingabe, aber zum Erleben des Horrors nicht weiter notwendig.

Wichtig ist unsere Situation und die ist Immersion pur. Wir schleichen durch die dunklen Gänge, versuchen das Monster frühzeitig zu hören, denn wenn es uns entdeckt bleibt uns nichts als zu Rennen und irgendwo einen leeren Schrank oder ein Bett, unter das wir uns verkriechen können, zu finden. Und dann zu warten. Mit pochendem Herzen und kaum zu unterdrückendem Atem, der uns, auch wenn wir ihn zu unterdrücken versuchen, dröhnend laut vorkommt. Irgendwann verliert das Monster das Interesse an uns und wir können uns langsam, vorsichtig schleichend herauswagen, um die Ecke spitzen und möglichst lautlos unseren Weg fortsetzen.

Dieser Weg heißt, Räume abzusuchen, Dinge zu finden, vor allem die, die wir für die Flucht brauchen. Drei Fluchtmöglichkeiten haben wir, alle bedürfen eine erkleckliche Zahl an Items und Vorbereitungen. Die Dunkelheit ist dabei sowohl Freund als auch Gegner, in ihr können wir uns besser verstecken, bemerken aber auch vieles nur schwer. In den unteren Decks stören uns zudem noch gebrochene Rohre, die rhythmisch heißen Dampf abgeben, der uns sogar töten kann. Weiter oben, in den Kabinengängen ist die Alarmanlage aktiv. Schwenkende Kameras lösen Alarm aus, wenn sie uns länger im Blick haben.

Welches der drei möglichen Monster uns jagt, wissen wir am Startpunkt nicht. Jedes reagiert sensualistisch in einem Bereich besonders empfindlich. Über das Design der Monstren selber läßt sich trefflich streiten, die Animationen gehören sicher nicht zu den ausgereiftesten. Allerdings sollten wir ja auch jeglichen Kontakt mit dem Monster tunlichst vermeiden und sollten wir es sehen, können wir eh nur reißaus nehmen und seinen heißen Atem in unserem Genick spüren. Wenn es uns kriegt sind wir tot und können nur einen neuen Versuch von Anfang starten.

Das Grundgerüst des Leveldesigns bleibt stets gleich, wir starten immer auf einem Containerschiff, dessen prinzipielle Struktur sich nicht ändert. Innerhalb dieser Struktur werden die einzelnen Räume allerdings bei jedem Durchgang neu prozedural platziert und natürlich werden auch alle Items zufällig platziert, so daß jeder Neustart eine neue Herausforderung darstellt. 

Technisch ist "Monstrum" sicher nicht perfekt, Animationen wirken teils staksig. Die Grafik ist sicher nicht die Schönste, aber sie leistet genau das, was sie soll, ist hochatmosphärisch, ebenso wie die spartanischen Sounds und Musikfetzen. Wenn das Schiff auf den Meereswogen hörbar arbeitet, hört man auf jedes Knacken.

Vergleiche sind immer schwierig, ich wage trotzdem einen: "Outlast", sicher ein aufwändiges und stark und sauber gemachtes Horror-Game, hat mich durchaus zeitweise unterhalten, mich aber auch immer wieder ob der überbordenden Leichenberge und Blutseen gelangweilt, wirkliche Angst hat es mir nie bereiten können. In "Monstrum" passiert wenig, das Spieltempo ist verdammt langsam und vorsichtig, es gibt nur einen Gegner, den wir vielleicht zwanzig Minuten gar nicht zu Gesicht bekommen (und wir sind froh drum). Aber genau das hat mich reingezogen, mir ein mulmiges Gefühl in der Magengegend gemacht, mich aufmerksam wie selten gemacht und mich dann, wenn etwas passierte, massiv erschrocken. Angst entsteht nämlich nicht durch einen akuten Angriff, sondern durch die Möglichkeit eines Angriffs. Nicht durch konkrete Gefahr, sondern durch potentielle Gefahr. Angst entsteht nicht auf dem Bildschirm, sondern im Kopf des Spielers, dann, wenn er sich ausmalt, was passieren könnte. "Monstrum" ist einer der besten Katalysatoren für dieses Gefühl.   

"Monstrum" erinnert im Kern an eine kleine Indie-Version eines "Alien: Isolation" ohne natürlich in Bezug auf Umfang oder Ausstattung an den ebenfalls grandiosen AAA-Titel heranzukommen. In Punkto Immersion kann es allerdings locker mithalten.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
10/10 Atmosphäre
9/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
10/10 Sound
9/10 Spielmechanik
9/10 Balancing
10/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
"Monstrum" ist erschreckend schauriger Survival-Horror.  

[h1][b]10/10 Gesamtwertung

23832065.review:
Monstrum? Was ist das denn für ein Spiel? Ist es ein Slender Abklatsch, oder doch eher ein Trash Game mit miserabler Grafik? Ich behaupte Mal keines von beidem, Monstrum ist ein ziemlich gelungenes Horror Survival Game mit Widerspielwert. Da Monstrum kein billiger "Slender" Abklatsch ist merkt man auch, dass die Entwickler hier auf keinen Fall etwas kopieren wollten. Denn statt plumpe Zettel oder was weiß ich zu suchen, muss man in Monstrum einfach gesagt von einem großen Schiff flüchten und es gibt 3 Wege das zu bewerkstelligen.

Daher brauch man beispielsweise um mit einem gerissenen Schlauchboot zu flüchten erstmal eine Pumpe und ein Tape um es vollständig bestriebsbereit zu machen. Ein tolles Feature ist auch, dass sich das Schiff bei jeder Spielrunde immer etwas verändert. Die Items die man zum flüchten braucht sind immer woanders was den Wiederspielwert meiner Meinung nach erhöht. Wer hat schon Lust immer durch den gleichen Wald mit dem gleichen Gegner zu laufen und einfach nur Zettel einzusammeln? Und wenn das mit der Abwechslung immer noch nicht reicht dann kann ich noch sagen, dass es 3 verschieden Monster (Oder Monstren) gibt und alle 3 anders ticken. Wie diese aussehen und ticken könnt ihr selbst herausfinden, indem ihr euch das Spiel kauft! 

Dieses Spiel ist eine nette Abwechslung für Horrorspielfans, aber auch normale Leute kommen hier auf ihre Kosten! Natürlich ist Monstrum keine Gameplaybombe mit herausragender Grafik, aber jetzt Mal ganz ehrlich, wenn es so wäre würde es auch sicherlich mehr kosten.

Das war mein Review zu Monstrum, ich hoffe ich konnte einigen Leuten deren Entscheidung noch offen stand ob sie Monstrum kaufen oder nicht somit die Entscheidung erleichtern ;)

Viel Spaß mit Monstrum oder dem Spiel was ihr stattdessen kauft.

Hier noch eine kurze Punktebewertung:

Gameplay: 3,5/5 
(Allgemein betrachtet Okay, für das Genre allerdings Gut.)

Sound: 4,5/5
(Gut, ohne Sound wäre die Atmospähre eher mangelhaft.)

Atmospähre: 4/5 
(Durchgehende Anspannung da man nie Safe ist.)

Story: 2/5 
(Sehr Plump aber auch unwichtig, bei dem Gameplay.)

Grafik: 3/5
(Man muss bedenken es ist ein low budget Indiehorrorgame daher Okay)

Gesamtwertung: 17/25 

Ps: Ich bewerte auch andere Horror Spiele :D !

23496931.review:
Very good and fun horror game.

The game contains 3 randomly chosen monster and 3 escape route (helicopter, submarine, safe boat). All escape route requires different items to find. Your inventory is limited to 6 items, so choose well what you pick up. To survive, you need to listen to the different sounds (Brute), the lighting (Fiend) and the bubbles on the wall or ground (Hunter). Always lock the doors, when you can. In a chase, locking doors can give you time to hide and save your life (except when you play against the Brute, it can destroy and go through any doors easily). There are limited ways to protect yourself from the monsters (like fire, fire extinguisher etc.). Don't think that you can avoid the monster if you go to the other side of the ship. It will follow you at some point.
I find the Hunter the hardest monster as it's fast, can go through vents and makes traps. The Brute is fairly easy, but in a chase it can be hard to hide from it. The Fiend is the easiest, if the lights are flickering then it's close, makes it easy to hide.

The graphics is pretty good, nothing jawdropping though. I didn't really find any bugs.
I just hope the developers will work on this game more, polishing it and giving us new contents.

I recommend it to people who likes hide & seek survival horror games and cute monsters.

[h1] TL;DR- [/h1]

No replayability, not really scary, overall maybe 4.5/10. 


[h1] Full Review [/h1]

Sure, it's a terrifying game the first time around, but once you unlock all three of the monsters, the "scary" factor of their jumpscares decreases greatly. The only one that's actually scary (in my opinion, anyway) is the one that [spoiler] actually runs, because you can hear his(it's?) footsteps chasing you [/spoiler]. The one that [spoiler] jumps around [/spoiler] is probably the second scariest, and then that last [spoiler] ghosty [/spoiler] one is just kind of stupid (and not very scary at all, not even the first time it catches you). 

Not much replayability (at all), and one playthrough is pretty short. The plot/concepts is admittedly very bland and trash as well, and there aren't even any intense insane terrifying elements in the game to make up for that. 

Don't get this? It might be okay on an intense (INTENSE) sale if you're really curious/REALLY want it, but otherwise I'd reccomend other horror games with depth like Outlast or Amnesia (even though everyone's probably played those already but whatever shhhhhhh), or just watch a YouTuber play it.

23310473.review:
[b]+[/b] 'Okay' graphics, it's not the prettiest Unity engine game ever created but for an indie game in general it looks really professional.

  [b]+[/b] Genius monster design. There's plenty of variety in all 3 monsters regarding their strengths, weaknesses, traits and design. All of them play into a different human fear (horrific physical strength, being stalked and the supernatural respectively)

  [b]+[/b] Genuinely scary, which is sadly a rare sight among indie horror games. I always try to steer clear from the cargo bay as best as I can because I'm not venturing through that dark, creepy maze unless I'm absolutely certain I have to.

  [b]+[/b] A surprisingly huge amount of depth to gameplay. There's far more items than just the key items required to escape the cargo ship and they all have their uses.
Lighters can be used to illuminate an area or ignite a pool of gasoline on the floor to hold off a monster.
Tape is required to repair the life raft but can also be used to sabotage camera's.
I'm telling you, it's amazing how much you can actually do in this game so it's sad to see some people (falsely) claim there's nothing more to Monstrum than hiding in lockers.

  [b]+[/b] Interesting setting. I don't believe I've seen a cargo ship used in horror games before but it really makes sense. It feels right for a horror game.
The ship itself looks really good and the rooms, from living quarters to engine room, are believable locations.

  [b]+[/b] The difficulty is just right.
You're going to die on your first playthrough. Probably also on the next. Possibly on many more to come.
And that's okay. Because of the wide range of options in this game, I never really feel like the monster cheated or I died to unfair b*llshit.
This is why I don't mind this game being difficult even if you've already completed it several times. This, combined with the ship's random layout everytime you play the game, makes for great replayability.

-----

  [b]-[/b] Questionable animation quality.

  [b]-[/b] Weak audio design, the audio is usually nothing but distant, broken steam pipes and a random noise once every few minutes that doesn't mean anything.
Also a BIG sound problem: The attenuation on some sounds is just plain misleading. Sound volume doesn't seem to be affected by distance in height, meaning it's impossible to tell whether a monster is roaring or thumping right next to you or  a floor safely above/below you.

  [b]-[/b] Could use some performance optimisation, though in general it runs fine on most computers.

Pour le jeu ça veut dire qu'on va faire spawner le monstre juste à côté de vous (voire dans la pièce que vous venez de fouiller) peu importe que vous ayez paumé le bestiaux à l'autre bout du bateau pour aller à l'autre bout. ça veut dire aussi que les monstres sont munis d'un GPS, si vous êtes repéré dans un bâtiment, que vous en sortez et en faites plusieurs fois le tour, la brave bête restera à l'intérieur car son GPS lui indique que ça va plus vite de passer par l'intérieur du bâtiment, du coup elle tourne aussi, dans le bâtiment et sans vous voir, et ça peut durer longtemps... Jusqu'à ce que vous en ayez marre de troller, en fait. Le spawn de bêbêtes et leur "IA" constitue le gros défaut du jeu, c'est dommage, c'était un peu la seule chose qu'il fallait faire correctement.
Sinon on a quelques petits défauts, comme les portes qui vous poussent du côté que vous voulez isoler parce qu'elles considèrent que vous êtes sur le chemin (ce qui est assez rigolo en fait).
Bref, au début, ça marche, l'ambiance sonore instaure une réelle angoisse, les moyens de localiser les monstres sont intéressants, mais ça ne tient pas longtemps, parce que ça n'a pas été pensé pour. Si vous voulez un bon jeu d'horreur, à moins d'être complètement néophyte et d'avoir de l'argent à perdre (parce que c'est pas cher mais ça les vaut pas), passez votre chemin.

23238446.review:
If you are thinking of buying this game for the Vive. Stop. Don't do it. The game has no Vive support. It was designed for the Oculus and only the Oculus. You can play it on the Vive by downloading additional software and editing some shortcut targets which I did, but the game was not enjoyable at all. Steam does not even recognize that you are playing it and will show you having zero minutes played which is likely why you aren't seeing more negative reviews from Vive users. You need to have played for 5 minutes to write a review. I played for 11 on my pc without VR just to be able to write this since Vive time was not counted. 

About the game. It is a decent idea. You run around a dark scary ship, trying to avoid monsters, picking stuff up, completing objectives. The sounds are quite good and scary. The graphics are pretty bad and the controls are really bad. You basically have two options for controls. A keyboard/mouse which I think is ideal, but also chalenging since you cannot see it while in VR or an xbox style controller. The xbox controller is not as good, but it is easier to use without looking and better for standing while you play which is important. You can play seated, but you will likely get very nausous. I have a strong stomach, but after about 4 minutes of seated play I had to stop because I thought I was going to vomit. Standing is much better. 

Pros: Sounds
         Concept

Cons: No Vive support
          Controls
          Graphics Quality
          Few if any updates
          Price

Overall, I would not recommend the game. There are much better horror titles out right now and more coming in a couple weeks. I picked it up on sale for $5 so I am not overly disappointed, but I doubt I will ever play it again unless the developer adds full Vive support so it can be played more easily while standing with a better control system.

Remember the least fun parts of Amnesia, Outlast or Alien Isolation, where there is a monster that will instantly kill you, but you need to find some items to get past the area? This game is those parts, repeated over and over.

1. Try to find item.
2. Monster sees you.
3. Run and hide.
4. Go to step 1 and repeat until dead.

Then you start it all again from the beginning every time. If that sounds like the sort of thing you'd enjoy then go for it. Personally, I just find it stressful, and eventually, annoying.

23184720.review:
[h1]ОТЛИЧНО![/h1]

[i]Монструм представить без сюжетного инди хоррора, с небольшой генерацией уровней, но чертовски хороший. Механика и геймплей очень примитивные, однако получилась весьма неплохая игрулька. С удовольствием побегал два вечера от местных монстров.[/i]

Кстати, всего их трое: [i]Дуделка, Сопля и Джин.[/i] Задача всего одна – спастись с загадочного корабля. Он необитаем, всё что можно найти это записки и немного аудиозаписей. Как мы сюда попали, кто мы и прочее к сожалению, не объяснят. Вся информация сводится к таинственному контейнеру из которого вылез монстр (каждый раз случайно генерируется). Как и примерно 20% помещений, остальное остаётся неизменным. Ну и естественно предметы раскидывают в разные комнаты. Искать придётся вещи для починки лодки, батискафа или вертолёта. И как раз эти трое будут вам мешать. Не все сразу, по одному, но каждый из них уникален и ведёт себя по-разному. Не буду расписывать все их особенности, скажу лишь, что каждый неприятен и действительно пугает. Особо впечатлительные могут так никуда и не уехать или за правду очень бояться. Сам я первые минут 20 побаивался выходить из комнат, но потихоньку пошло-поехало. В итоге 6 часов игры и все достижения.

[u]Геймплей[/u] прост до безобразия! Всего одна жизнь и случайно генерируемый монстр из представленных. Если поймал, начинаем сначала. Весь прогресс обнуляется, карты перестраиваются. В остальном слоняемся по комнатам в поисках нужных вещей, конечно если поняли и знаете, что нужно что бы сбежать на конкретном транспорте. Додуматься легко, но, если уж совсем тяжело есть гайды. Пока собираем барахло шкеримся в шкафах и прячемся под койками дабы монстр не спалил. Следим за издаваемым шумом, не дай бог попадётесь на камеру и завоет тревога. И даже собрав всё необходимое нельзя до конца на 100% быть уверенным что не попадётесь прямо перед отбытием. Заправляем вертолёт? Естественно это шумно, за вами уже идут. В самый последний момент моб может сломать нужные аппараты и на этом транспорте спастись уже не получится. Сам попал в такой капкан, Сопля сломал панель управления батискафом прямо перед погружением, пришлось улетать на вертолёте. Нужно быть внимательным и прислушиваться к шуму. 

Попутно есть просто приятные моменты. Можно оставлять светящиеся фонарики чтобы не заблудится, включать или выключать свет (это влияет на геймплей), заманивать врага или с помощью него открывать недоступные комнаты. В целом сам корабль симпатичный, а главное не гигантский. На первый побег ушло 2 часа, а настроение после было на высоте. Графика для инди весьма добротная, ничего не лагает. Дизайн и анимация монстров иногда смешит правда, особенно когда наблюдаете их прячась в шкафчиках, но до самого конца они ещё покажут, что не рядовые болванчики. Плюс, у них отличный звук, он внушает беспокойство. Хочу ещё отметить хорошие достижения, они позволяют задержаться в игре, а не бросить её сразу после первого же спасения, интересно выполнять. Многим инди такого не хватает.

[i]Итог – отличный хоррор побегать вечерок, максимум два и наложить маленькую горочку кирпичиков.[/i]

23156589.review:
I don`t ever get scared by games, but after seeing the reviews I thought I`d try this. And it was on a very good sale.
Again, my attitude is `It`s just a game with just animated pixels in a 3D virtual environemnt; it`s not real. There`s nothing to be scared of.

Yet, when you start the game and start exploring this deserted ship, a sense of unease starts to grip you. You don`t know what happened. You know it isn`t good. You know that there`s something wandering out there, but it`s a game, how bad can it be?

You walk down the eerily silent corridors with the odd flickering light. You enter a small room, find a torch, a fuse and a tape recorder you switch it on. The recording plays the voice of some guy talking about something strange going on. It dawns on you that the recording is quite LOUD. You dismiss the loud tape noise although a quiet volume control would be nice.

Boom, boom, boom!
The sudden sound of really heavy footsteps makes you jump- what the heck was that?

BOOM, BOOM, BOOM!

Cripes, that sounded like it was right outside the door. You crouch and try to find somewhere to hide before the door opens. There`s no other door, nothing to hide under. then you see what looks like large storage  cabinet. You try the handle- It opens! You crawl inside and wait. Wait.

Something`s in the room now... searching about.

I quit the game.

Damn. No game has ever stressed me out like that before!

10\10 for atmosphere and I haven`t even seen the Thing yet!

Ok, the basics:

You`re a lone survivor of some terrible catastrophe that has presumably killed the crew of the ship you`re on. You wake up confused in a small room and have to get out before whatever killed the crew finds you and kills you.

There are items you need to find that will help you as you try to find a way out.

Pros:
1. Great atmosphere. You know something bad has happened.

2. There`s something out there. Every now and then you can hear something walking about and it don`t sound Human or good.

3. It hears if you make a loud noise or most noises for that matter- Be quiet.

4. You can try to distract it by chucking breakable stuff, but it don`t always work.

5. You can run. If you`re lucky, it will lose you. Hint: make many twists and turns. Try not to panic.

6. You can set your controls to personal preference- essential in a game like this.

7. The monster (I`ve met one) Are pretty horrible- And they WILL kill you if they catch you.

8. Great sound effects from the ditsnt sounds of something opening a door to the pounding sound of running feet right behind you.

9. Each new game randomises the ship rooms which adds real longevity to nthe game. Great idea.

10. Apparently there are 3 monsters which randomise with each game. Great idea.

Cons:

1. To be honest can`t think of any. It would be nice to choose skin colour for those of us who aren`t white and want to be more immersed, but no big deal really.

2. Monster (at least the one I saw before it broke my neck) are scary, but I`d like them even more frightening.


Conclusion: Game that really manages to put you on the nervous edge of your seat. It doesn`t use jump scares, but the fear of the terrible unknown that you can`t possibly defeat; the blackness that wants to take you and doesn`t care.

Very well executed. Recommended. 

For extra effect play at night with the lights off!

23120796.review:
I love horror games, and I'm always looking for ones that can give me a good scare... Sadly there's not many that have recently, thanks to most horror games relying on jump scares, which do nothing for me. (Amnesia: TDD has been the most recent game to give me a good scare.) So I bought this game based off the reviews, and even though so many people were talking about how terrifying it could be, I still expected that it wouldn't provide much scare...

So then I turned it on, waited for the level to load. Walked through the brief tutorial room. Started thinking "Hmmm, it's Outlast... No big deal."
Walked up the stairs into the next room, got caught off-guard by the security cameras. Turned and seen one facing me, started thinking "hah, you're just a camera, you can't do anything."
Found the security room, closed the door behind me, started scrounging around for supplies. 
Went to turn the light on, heard the door creak open, turned to the door just quick enough to see the Fiend nonchalantly walk in before taking my frail life with the greatest of ease.

There's just something so amazingly creepy about a monster slowly advancing toward you, as you try to figure out how, and if, you can possibly survive such an encounter... 10/10, I may never be able to leave a door closed again.

23094627.review:
注意，这是一篇 VR 版游戏评测。我使用的是 Oculus DK2.


其实，在《Monstrum》出 Oculus Rift头显正式补丁之前，已经有好几款游戏大作都是原生支持 Oculus 头显的，其中就有《异形：隔离》、《消失的光芒》、《消失的伊森卡特》等优秀作品，开发商对此并没有做出太大的宣传，玩家们也需要手动修改游戏设定并使用扩展模式才能使用 Oculus 头显玩个痛快。但是这一次不一样，《Monstrum》的开发工作室JUNKFISH决定不再低调行事，在确定与 Oculus 的合作之后，便立即开始制作新版本。这一点也是具有里程碑意义的。
 
作为一款恐怖游戏，《Monstrum》的背景设定是相当有趣，空无一人的废弃船只，破败不堪的船内环境，到处游走的恐怖怪物，让人觉得遍体生寒。在该游戏没有支持 Oculus 头显之前，各大游戏媒体给出的评价几乎都是胆小者别玩，隔着一个电脑屏幕，玩家们都被吓唬得不行。那么，当玩家进行虚拟现实体验的时候呢，恐怖指数还会一路攀升。

尽管，《Monstrum》这款游戏已经上市已有大半年光景，玩家们也都失去了对于这款游戏的新鲜感，游戏解说们也几乎都已做完各种流程视频和攻略视频，甚至一些特殊的玩法也被他们开发殆尽。这时候JUNKFISH工作室再来推出虚拟现实补丁是不是有一些炒冷饭的嫌疑呢？答案是否定的，就目前的形式而言，虚拟现实头显已然发展成为一种全新的游戏平台，它不同于传统游戏平台，它是由传统游戏平台发展而来，是玩家们对于游戏的最高追求——沉浸式的体验。身临其境才是玩家们最想要的。

从我的试玩体验来看，这款游戏因为有了VR模式，所以显得更加恐怖。JUNKFISH工作室在将普通的第一人称游戏视角改为沉浸式视角的后，尽管还是有一些细节不尽如人意，可是游戏体验确实提高不少。对于部分动作也进行了许多契合VR模式的修改，这让人更加期待之后VR模式完整版的出现。

不过，目前最新的 1.4 版本，已经支持 Oculus CV1。 很期待使用 CV1 来体验。

最后，我们下一个 VR 游戏的评测界面见！！！

22960698.review:
Монструм - игра с огромным потенциалом, который загублен всего одной своей особенностью. Действительно, идея замкнутого пространства в виде корабля, в котором нужно быстро реагировать, продумывать свои ходы, прятаться и убегать, шикарна! И все, вроде бы, есть для великолепного геймплея: многоуровневый корабль, три вида спасения с него, три вида монстров, не похожие друг на друга, различный лут, места для пряток, камеры наблюдения, записки - истории и т.п. НО! Реализации всему этому мешает, как я уже сказал, одна особенность - "телепортация" монстров к игроку. Вам дается от начала игры две минуты одиночества, после чего в игру запускается один из монстров, который респится недалеко от вас. Поэтому, желательно находиться рядом с лестницей, чтобы была возможность сдристнуть на другой конец корабля и пожить лишних пару-тройку минут. Но вам не укрыться... Через эти минуты вы уже слышите дыхание или шаги монстра. Решили спрятаться? Поздравляю - вы выиграли тоскливое безрезультатное ожидание. Монстр будет кружиться рядом с тем местом, где вы спрятались, даже не думая уйти искать вас на других уровнях корабля. Вам повезло - вы на кортах смогли уползти из шкафа/ящика/подкроватного пространства и на кортах закорячились с конца корабля в начало в самый темный уголок на самую нижнюю палубу. Вы облегченно вздыхаете, вытирая холодный пот со лба, и идете искать лут. Но через три минуты вы, если не наткнетесь, то услышите топот/свист/дыхание монстра, находящегося рядом с вами. Вы бежите быстрее ветра от него, обжигаясь паром из поломанных труб, ломая голову, как он вас нашел, находите лестницу, тревожная музыка затихает. Вы снова возвращаетесь в конец корабля, откуда вы уже уползали. Решаете полутаться. Только не забудьте про камеры наблюдения, которые истошно орут при виде вас, игнорируя почему-то монстров. Не забыли? Молодцы! Обследовали несколько комнат и решили спуститься на следующий ярус? Будьте готовы к тому, что вы столкнетесь с монстром на лестнице. Или увидете его поднимающимся по ней. Как он тут очутился? Науке это неизвестно... Вы снова бежите, проклиная его звериное чутье, собачий нюх и подозреваете монстра в использовании валлхака. Иначе, как еще понять, почему он вас находит. Выше описанные действия повторять до умопомрачения. У меня однажды была такая ситуация: успешно скрывшись от монстра, я ушел в самый конец корабля к спасательному боту. Против меня был огромный топающий товарищ, которого слышно за версту. Так вот, болтаюсь я, значит, рядом с ботом и слышу: бежит! Я скорее спрятался за ящики, смотрю, прибегает этот товарищ (не пришел, прибежал) и встал. Меня он не видел, не слышал, музыка обнаружения не играла. Думаю, сейчас уйдет. Ага. Он топтал площадочку площадью метров десять минут пятнадцать, пока я прятался. После чего мне это надоело, я побежал. Только тогда, он, радостно взревев, убежал за мной. Или же я спрятался в комнатке с прямым коридором. Так монстр тупо ходил взад - вперед по нему, пока я не вылез, и он меня не убил. Или же случай, когда я все сделал для спасательного бота, спустил его на воду, а на месте выхода стоял монстр, поджидая меня... Я дважды спасался с корабля за все это время, но, знаете, победы не приносят радости - вы полностью морально истощены постоянной беготней от монстра, который всегда находит игрока. Понять разработчиков ИИ можно. Им же надо как-то сделать встречу монстра с игроком. Но не таким же способом! Дайте больше времени полутаться. Почему монстр, от которого игрок уполз незамеченным, находит его через три минуты на другом конце корабля именно на том этаже, где сидит игрок? Я не понимаю. Играть нет никакого желания. И абсолютно не страшно становится. Ты знаешь, что тебя найдут в любом случае в любом месте.

P.S.
Я не играл год, с момента релиза, но решил еще раз себя проверить на крепость нервов. Заметил пару вещей, которых не было раньше: 
1) при приближении парящего монстра лампы иногда не мигают, что грозит вам инфарктом при внезапной встрече из-за угла или когда вы обернетесь.
2) здоровяк периодически ходит неслышно (на цыпочках, видимо)
3) пропал звук ломаемых монстрами дверей
4) сопляк периодически сидит у двери комнаты, в которую вы вошли и закрыли за собой дверь, что тоже вам грозит инфарктом, когда вы ее откроете.

22909175.review:
Monstrum is a first person survival horror game where you need to escape from a ship by one of the available escape methods while being stalked and chased by a monster. if you get caught, you die, and you have to start again.

I buy scary games and I don't know why. I'm easily scared, but there is some kind of thrill to it which is enjoyable. Monstrum doesn't disappoint here - the persistant element of threat and terror of being stuck on a big ship, in the middle of nowhere, alone with something that wants to kill you, really comes across. you can't kill what's chasing you (ala Clock Tower and such like), running and hiding is your only option.

What Monstrum isn't is a surival horror game with a deep engaging storyline or puzzles, or cutscenes. Think of this as an escape challenge with horror elements. Every time you play, the layouts of the rooms and corridors are different, the objects you need to pick up are all randomly placed around the ship (but the core layout of the ship, the escape routes, crew and lower deck areas are in the same location). Also, there are three monsters, one of which will be randomly chosen that will chase you down, so you never know who you're up against until you start playing. So this game has definite replayability.

Graphically, it isn't the prettiest game, and I do notice performance issues from time to time (I'm running I5 4690k with GTX 760, Evo840 SSD), especially when there is a monster close by. Also, it has bugged out on me a few times - one of the monsters in one game got caught on the stairs. I could have just continued and won the game with no issues, but that would have been no fun and so I restarted. None of these however ruined the experience for me.

Sound however is brilliant. For me, a horror game has to have good sound and Monstrum doesn't fail here.

Want a good night in with friends with a horror game? Look no further. No really! Pass the controller around, and set the challenge - first person to get off the ship wins. 

If you want a good horror game that will give you a few good hours of scares and creeps then Monstrum is a good choice. Highly recommended.

22123375.review: As someone who has beaten all 3 monsters and all 3 escape routes, i think im qualified to write a review on this game. First of all: hats off to the sadistic mind who though up the monsters, they are terrifying. The story is fairly generic; you wake up on a ship and dont know how you got there. There are a few notes of the ships recent history although they are little more than a distraction and do not add to the overall story much. After walking out the door the first thing you will notice is there is alot of detail put into this game; it feels like it could be a real ship, there is a kitchen, bathrooms, living quarters, storage, mantainance areas and a cargo hold. The atmoshpere is quite creepy to start with however there is no sense that you are about to experience the most terrifying game of cat and mouse you will ever see. After a while you will begin to hear things go bump in the night, and this really puts you on edge and sets the stage for when you ineveitbly encounter the monstrosity you will be facing this time, thats right; there are 3 different monsters and each time a game is loaded up it is randomly selected and there is no way of knowing which one has spawned until you com face to face. Unlike other indie horrors the monsters in this game are completely different and need to be handled differently. The ship itself is also randomly generated however this is highly opinionative as only the layout of certain areas and item spawns are different. One of the downsides to this is it is very easy to get lost and retrace your path over and over getting frustrated about how you have checked everywhere only to 20 minutes later find that there was some well camoflauged door that had the item you need, there are some more nasty surprises waiting around the ship but im not going to spoil. All in all this is one of the most polished and well done horror games period, unlike others it has heavy replay value and even on that final time i defeated this game my heart was still racing just as fast as the first time. The devs know what they wanted out of this game and pulled it off spectacularly and i would recommend this to anyone who wants a horror experience that is less focused on an intricate and confusing story and more poop your pants terrifying. 11/10

22041183.review:
Monstrum is one of the most intense horror games I've ever played. Even hardcore horror gamers will have a hard time beating it.


[b]Pros:[/b]

+ Awesome environment. The ship has everything you don't want when you are being hunted: Narrow corridors, small rooms, dead ends, traps and so on. 
+ Great graphics and design. Nice to look at and eerie.
+ Deeply terrifying monsters. All three of them are living nightmares. With their different characteristics, your strategy has to change in every playthrough. 
+ Equally terrifying sounds. Even the doors are scary.
+ The randomly generated map ensures that you'll never be able to rush through the game.
+ Three different escape routes, each usable with other items.
+ The game doesn't rely on programmed jumpscares, it's rather the monster's smart pathfinding AI that lifts you out of your chair when you run into them frontally.
+ You can interact with the monsters by attracting them with radios and egg timers, shooting them with flares and fire extinguishers and setting them on fire with gasoline. That's truly helpful when you want to troll them, but I'm fairly certain that you'll find more serious ways to use that.
+ Monstrum is difficult but beatable over time.


[b]Cons:[/b]

- Technical limitations with the AI cause weird situations. For example, when you hide under a table, perfectly visible to anyone in the room, the monster won't see you, even when it's standing directly next to you.
- A few glitches that let the monsters getting stuck. However, you won't even think about exploiting them in your first playthroughs. Trust me on that.


All in all, Monstrum is a truly terrifying experience, even for the bravest of you.

21924913.review:
조또 할거 없던 게임 불경기 때 나온 혜자게임 몬스트럼.

처음에 이거 보고 시발 이건 뭔 게임이여 하고 그냥 사다가 틀어봤다.

그땐 뭐에 홀렸는지.... 존나 이새끼 존나 멋지다 하고 만났는데

알고 보니 조낸 허당에 개찐따일 때의 여성의 그 심리라 할까....

다만 이 경우는 좀 반대이다.

아 시바 내가 왜 이런 놈이랑 소개팅을 해야 해... 비주얼도 별로고.... 딱히 매력도 없어보이는데...

근데 만나고 나니 오 시바 이남자 이거 진국이다!!! 꺄르르륵 잼나다~ 지루하지 않아~ 사람이 알짜배기네!!!

이런 느낌의 게임이다.

뭐 볼륨 없다... 하나의 맵에서 몬스터 세마리 돌려대면서 세가지 탈출 방법으로 몬스터별 3가지씩의 엔딩이 존재한다.

다이렉트 9 기반의 시대를 역행하는 그래픽에 은근히 개적화,  조낸 단순한 사운드, 투박한 인터페이스와 컨트롤...

이해할 수 없는 템들의 위치... 그리고 근본 없는 어디 유명 게임의 짝퉁같은 몬스터들...

이런걸로 보면 내가 대체 게임을 까는건치 칭찬하는건지 헷갈릴 것이다. 나도 헷갈린다.

근데 엄청나게 오래 했다.. 진심... 게임BJ로서 이 게임은 한때 잠시 인기비제이가 뭔지를 대충 맛보게 해준 게임이다.

단순간 게임이지만 몬스터들이 허술하게 쫓아오고 갑툭튀 할 때의 심쿵하는 느낌을 시청자들과 격렬한 공유도 했었고.

처음엔 무서워서 뭐도 못했지만 익숙해지니깐 이건 더 이상 공포가 아니라 되려 괴물들을 희롱(?)하는 

역관광 게임이 되어버렸으며 그 재미에 게임을 즐겼고 색다른 진행에 시청자들도 엄청 즐겨봐주셨다.

찹찹이라 불리우는 액체 괴물(나중에는 가둬놓고 불을 지르는 재미가 있다)

까칠한 보라누나(염동력으로 나를 구속하려는 얀데레... 문을 사이에 두고 밀당하는 재미)

답없는 헐크 개새끼(이새낀 진짜 덩치도 커서 길막하면 뚫고 못간다 , 빌어먹을 근육돼지 새끼...)

소화기 하나로 괴물들을 농락하면서 슬슬 공포심을 떨어뜨릴 수 있고 

오히려 괴물들에게 공포의 존재가 되어가는 나를 발견할 수 있다.

아쉬운 점은 스킨이라도 바꾸게 해줘서 귀신이나 다른 유저제작 모델들이 쫓아오게 해줬으면 좋았을거 같다는 점이다.

그럼 더욱 더 오래~ 그리고 질리지 않게 게임을 즐길 수 있었을 텐데 이는 아쉬울 따름이다 ㅠ

에일리언 아이솔레이션이 블록버스터 대작이라 치면 이건 엄청 잘 만든 독립영화 같은 기분이다.

다시 보고 싶고, 더 많은 얘기를 할 수 있고, 게임 보는 눈을 키워준 내 마음 속 2015 GOTY 게임이라 할 수 있다.

싸게 할인 하면 한번 꼭 해보길 바란다.

21824938.review:
I have only played this game for thirty minutes so far, and then I had to take a break ... Whoa!

For the first time throughout my YouTube horror channel hobby, I had to edit the volume down on a few select parts of my playthrough due to sheer panic. I should mention that this was combined with the Oculus Rift DK2 device, which should enhance the atmosphere and feel quite a lot (I have not tried without it, but judging by past experiences, the DK2 makes it seem so much more real and tense)!

I play all my horror games blindly (going into the game without researching anything about it), and if you are reading this, then I think you should, too. Tune up your headset enough so you can hear the ambiance and detail. I remember at one point, I just crouched down in a corner, merely listening to the environment and trying to analyze something stomping around on another floor which was looking for something to eat, or at the very least something to scare the living soul out of!

If you enjoy games rich on atmosphere and ambiance, and if you enjoy being scared, then definitely try this out. If you also happen to have an Oculus Rift device (DK2 or newer), then YES, definitely put them on and play this!

21199524.review:
[h1] "A Monstrous, Horrific time!" [/h1]


Monstrum is a first person survival horror game which finds players stranded aboard a vast, derelict ship filled with traps, environmental hazards, and another passenger in the shape of a terrifying and deadly being..

I've always found that ships are the perfect location for horror, yet they're rarely used. 
There's the occasional movie, a couple of games, but nine times out of ten you're likely to find yourself poking around in an abandoned asylum or a creepy forest.
Monstrum understands what makes a ship such a scary place. Totally isolated and painfully claustrophobic, it's an environment from which escape is nightmarishly difficult.
From the moment you wake up on the ship, you quickly realise that you are, quite literally, stuck between the devil and the deep blue sea with very little chance to survive...

[h1] Escape the ship! [/h1]

Escape is your solitary goal, and there are several ways to achieve this. You could make for a life raft, try to start the helicopter tethered to the main deck, or else head into the bowels of the ship and try to flee in the sub, if you can work out how to get it into the water.

Each method of escape requires different objects to complete. 
You'll need bolt cutters to remove the moorings on the helicopter. 
The life raft is handled by a crane that must be fixed. 
The sub needs power cells and a replacement headlight. 

The objects needed to meet these goals are also subject to Monstrum's roguelike qualities, and shuffled and repositioned along with the corridors and rooms. The only constant is that you always start next to a room containing a torch and a fuse.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Gameplay takes the form of careful and methodical exploration, checking every room for essential items, as well as other objects that might prove useful: glowsticks, a fire extinguisher or flare gun, or just things like radios and egg timers that can create a distraction. 
There are also environmental hazards, such as broken steam pipes (that can annoyingly kill you instantly) and security cameras which will sound a monster-alerting alarm if you linger in their frame for too long.

It's really all about the monsters though. So much so that revealing too much about them feels like the only thing in the game that could count as a spoiler.  The one revealed in screenshots and trailers is The Brute, a shambling muck-monster with gaping, glowing eyes and mouth.  There are also creatures known as The Hunter and The Fiend, each of which has its own unique and creepy design, and their own distinctive attack patterns. 
You'll know The Fiend is nearby, for example, as it disrupts electricity, causing the lights to flicker.

This is, a ruthless perma-death game.
Meaning, the only things that carry across from one playthrough to the next are the notes you'll find scattered around the ship, filling in the backstory of the strangely absent crew and offering not terribly subtle hints as to what's required to secure the various escape routes. 
Playthroughs can be as brutally short as a few minutes, while a successful escape can take anywhere from 20 to 40 minutes depending on how lucky or cautious you are.
It's the luck factor that eventually turns Monstrum from a thrillingly sinister exploration adventure, to a frustrating game of chance. 

The game is so random that there's almost no room for the player to exert any kind of agency or strategy. Which escape plan you opt for depends largely on which useful item you stumble across first, while finding the other items needed to complete the task are basically needles in a haystack. 
You'll only work out what you need through accumulated failure, but even once you know exactly what to do, your chances of success are governed more by your luck, good or otherwise, with regard to the monster and the items spawned on the ship.

[h1] Enemies of the dark! [/h1]

While they apparently have different AI criteria dictating how they hunt you, your encounters with them are almost always going to be the same: walk round a corner, get spotted, run, hide, fail to hide, get killed. 
The chances to use the ship to your advantage, by locking doors or setting distractions, are minimised by the fact that you have no idea when or where you'll encounter the beast, and when you do it becomes more about outrunning them than outsmarting them.

[h1] Environment! [/h1] 

In terms of production and design, Monstrum exceeds most other indie games of the same genre. Grungy as it is, it's still a lovely looking game.

The ship's random layout doesn't help in this regard, offering too many narrow linear corridors and dead end rooms with no hiding places. It's a shame, since it's a fantastic environment, and the reuse of endless, ever changing corridors and rooms lends the game a nightmarish quality.

Sadly, this feeling can turn into frustration as you search for the last elusive thing you need to escape, aware that any encounter with the monster is likely to find you starting over from scratch. 

Alien Isolation, one of my all time favourite survival horror games, works because you come to know the station, which has been designed in such a way that there's always a place to hide or an escape route to follow for the player who pays attention. 
Monstrum's spaces, limited as they are by their need to fit together in infinite ways, too often leave you with nowhere to go.

[h1] Verdict: [/h1]

Monstrum works best in the first hour you spend with it. 
That's when its monsters are still scary, the location is still mysterious and the randomised layouts are still able to excite you with their unknowable nature. It's no surprise that the game has been designed for VR. 

Unfortunately, that terror does eventually ebb away, not because the scares run dry but because progress so often falls to chance. 
Blundering around identical corridors, hoping to stumble across a solution before being assaulted by an unstoppable monster, makes for a brilliant one-off experience but is no bedrock for a satisfying long term challenge. 
There comes a point where the player has to feel some element of control, some sense that they might emerge victorious through their own ingenuity rather than blind luck, and Monstrum offers such moments too inconsistently.

Despite its flaws, I recommend it to anyone who loves survival horror.
It's scares may be brief, but I'll never forget the first time I came across the ghostly fiend, the alien-esque Hunter and the stupid lumbering brutes that roam the empty halls of this isolated ship.

[h1] Score:
7/10 [/h1]

21070071.review:
非常好玩的独立恐怖游戏，目前玩了4个小时，一次都没有成功逃生。
游戏玩起来的感觉有点像outlast，遇到怪物基本只能躲和跑——虽然看攻略可以用灭火器喷怪物一脸，不过制止怪物的时间太短，而怪物都是一击必杀型，调戏怪物简直是作死。
说到死，游戏里是没有存档点的，死了就要重新打，起点似乎有两个，随机。地图似乎是固定的，就是一整艘船的结构，只不过各种道具都会重刷到不同位置。稍不留神，前功尽弃。唯一留下来的是游戏的收集要素，避免了强迫玩家重复收集这些并不影响游戏进程的东西。
怪物总体上都非常变态，太过于机智了，让游戏难度非常大。如果你不是躲在一些特定的地方，你看到怪物时基本上怪物也看到你了，接下来就是残酷的追杀和躲猫猫。就目前看来我发现三种怪物：
一个类似熔岩怪一样的，靠近有沉重的脚步声，追杀时能秒破门。很帅。
一个类似影魔一样的，靠近时似乎周围光源会闪烁，似乎能穿门，影魔抓到玩家虐杀的方式我看到了两种，一种干脆的破颅，一种先折断左右手再破颅。很帅。
一个是半透明类似鱼和蜥蜴之类冷血动物的怪物，靠近的时候有特定叫声，追杀时三爪子破门。这哥们儿出场率极高，而且有时候是突然出现，比如突然从通风管道破框而出，有时候你在船外边它突然从船沿窜上来。另外有时候玩家会看到屋子的墙上有一坨黑色的蠕动的泡泡，遇到的时候请注视三分钟，[spoiler]然后你就会知道这些泡泡其实应该是蜥蜴怪的卵或者蛹或者巢[/spoiler]。很猥琐。
说他猥琐是因为他总是猛地出现，已经死在他嘴里很多次了。
从上看来，这游戏的门不像outlast的那般耐用，outlast的门自个儿跑的时候带上，能拖敌人不少时间。这游戏似乎怪物听到动静前来查看的时候是开门，此时能反锁的木门应该有作用——怪物觉得只是怀疑结果打不开就偷个懒走了？如果是看到玩家进屋要追杀玩家了，那就直接就破门而入了，反锁的木门也没用。而铁门似乎更不如木门，没有反锁，能直接打开——不过听说能用电焊工具焊上？那自己想出去呢？
我曾经不知道床底能躲，有时候没地方只能躲在桌子底下。据我观察，影魔一般看不到，熔岩怪没试过，蜥蜴怪躲两次桌底抓两次桌底。而且每次都是先跑过来瞄一会儿 ，跑到旁边（我一直没动）站一会儿，然后猛地跑过来拉我出来，简直是调戏玩家啊。
游戏的道具有很多种，单独的道具却不一定只有一种作用。大多用法都挺符合我们的正常生活思维。比如汽油除了提供能源动力外，其实还能泼在地上，然后用火源点燃，不过很容易把自己烧死，简直玩火自焚。不知道这火能不能用来对付怪物，不过这繁琐的点火操作，得需要多么周密的计划和技巧啊。。。
另外游戏的很多场景也有各种陷阱效果之类的，比如铁管冒蒸汽，会烫伤玩家并阻断玩家前进；疾跑通过有坑洞的地面会摔倒。这些场景，说白了就是为了玩家逃命的过程中让玩家被抓住。
最后说游戏成功逃生的方法不止一种，有直升飞机，潜水艇，救生筏。三种方式只要收集足够的道具，开够足够的机关，躲过足够的怪物，最后在启动逃生工具的时候再抵过一波怪物的攻击，就能成功逃生了。听起来挺简单的是不是？
p.s:遇到怪物首先还是得一个劲儿的跑，尽量直线跑，不然转向多了突然撞在玩家面前，跑的足够远再找地方躲，不然你当着怪物的面钻进箱子里，那就跟outlast一样瓮中捉鳖。
This cargo is a great nightmare !

21010684.review:
Great game!

+ Great sound design to help you know which of the monsters is after you.

+ Each Monster is unqiue. They have differing intelligance, speed, and strength, along with diffrent AI for how they work. 

+ Good replayability. There is 3 diffrent endings, and these endings have 3 diffrent sub endings, leading to up to 9 playthroughts for all content. Plus many secret achievments, and the monster is randomly picked each time

+ A good challenge. This game will kill you a few times before your first win, but each time you die you learn something new about the game.

+Good atmosphere. Dark claustrophobic corridors lead to a tense and creepy game, combinded with the sound it has a good atmosphere.

---------------------------------

- This game does cheat sometimes. You wont hear a monster coming, but it will suddenly be there without warning. One time, when putting a fuse in, the Brute (a monster that makes loud ass stomping noises and loud growls) somehow snuck up on me.

- Yes they have unique AI, but it's not exactly good, I went into a room, monster opens one cabinet and just walks off. This makes no sense, combined with the fact that they almost never pick where you're hiding unless it sees you go there.

------------------------------------------

If you have some spare money on you, I reccomend you pick this game up if you're at all interested in it.

------------------------------------------

I feel the need to edit this review to pay respects. This was a gift from a friends around christmas 2015, and earlier this year (2017), he passed away. While I had thanked him multiple times before, I want to leave one last Thank you to him. He was a great guy, and I miss him. Rest in Peace Trent.

21004275.review:
Shortly a unique Roguelike game.  Closest comparabable games are the Penumbra series, or more likely Amnesia The Dark Descent as there are no weapons to use. Just a few clumsy defensive items to slow down the monster that is chasing you. 

Idea is simple: Slightly randomized ship layout every time you play the game. 3 different predators that each have their own way of hunting you and 3 different ways to escape.  Death is permanent. No saving.  Good luck trying to survive. 

And it works really well. The feeling of evading a monster inside a crampy ship is really something. Death is literaly just some steps away very often or within arms reach as you hide under a table and the monster is looking for you in the dark doom. And always there are multiple ways out of the ship that is almost at your grasp but ah so far away. 

Sometimes you hear the monster behind the door. sometimes you can see it. And sometimes it sees you. And then you run. No, you retreat. you RUN. you rout like there is no tomorrow. You 'get the fuck out of dodge' like you have never done in any other game. Not even in Amnesia do you uncontrollably flee like in this game. 

And then you notice how you play the game silently. you barely even breathe because you are trying to make as little noise as possible. Too bad the game is a horror game. i bet the kids would be really silent playing this game if they would not be emotionally scarred by this. 

Good game all round but some small cons exist: Frame rate sometimes drops when the action is at the most frantic level and certain critical items are just too rare. (Fuses!) 

Highly recommendable due to unique 'Amnesia style' monster evading, hiding in the closet combined with rogue elements. 

Good luck beating the game. Good luck beating the game against all three monsters. Good luck even escaping one of them.

20995163.review:
This game. THIS FUCKING GAME. Let me tell you right now, that when you see one of the fucking monsters, you'll be running as if you were an ant being chased by 100 lions. Bruh, this game is fuckin' scary; Highly recommended if you like having one hell of an adrenaline rush.

EDIT: The reason for the lack of hours is because I've played this on a friends PC previously; just bought it on my account.

But in all seriousness, people that say they'd rather play "Alien: Isolation" don't get it. While I love Alien, this game is different; Alien is a game you can play once, and the scare mostly stops, you've experienced the game. Monstrum on the other hand has a lot of replayability because of the random generation, no item is in the same location, you never know what enemy you face, the rooms change, and it's just overall more challenging in my opinion. In conclusion; I love both games, but Monstrum is a better purchase if you want to get into the horror faster.

Kvôli rôznym chybám sa zasekávajú o rôzne predmety alebo naopak prechádzajú cez steny. Hra si však udržiava slušnú atmosféru. Hra sa k tomu momentálne predáva za prehnaných 15€, čo predstavuje sumu, za ktorú si možno kúpiť oveľa kvalitnejšie herné tituly ako je Amnesia a podobne.

20651549.review:
[code]Survival Horror, Indie, Rogue-like, VR,RNG[/code]

[h1]Concept[/h1]
[table]
[tr][td]Collectibles[/td][tr][td][h1]♥[/h1][/td][td]There is collectibles around the boat in the form of audio logs and notes [/td][/tr][tr][td]♡[/td][td]The loud sound audio recorders give off, gives off false impression that you are attracting monsters [/td][/tr][/tr]

20565360.review:
Играть в это без читов бессмысленно. И дело даже не в сложности и не в абсолютной неадекватности построения этажей... Monstrum одна из самых пугающих и атмосферных игр, безусловно, но постоянно натыкаться на баги — увольте. За первые часа 3 прошел игру против ползуна, было довольно легко, но в конце он, почему-то, застрял в вентеляционной шахте, так что выиграл я нечестно. Затем попал против Брута, который убил меня по косой: выбил дверь и сразу же протянул руку по сквозь стену, чтобы убить меня. Об Unit Collision разработчик не слыхал вовсе.

Следующую игру продул против ползуна, так как тот прыгнул в момент закрытия двери и всёравно умудрился меня сожрать, хотя дверь должна была захлопнуться. Дальше попал опять против Брута, взял бутылку и бросил с палубы 5 на палубу 4. И чтобы вы думали? Он не только не пошел на четвёртую палубу, а ещё и точно определил моё место положение (хотя я и сел в противоположном от источника звука месте), он должен был пройти по коридору прямо, но быстро повернулся ко мне. Я даже встать с присядки не успел, как он подбежал и вломил. Иными словами, понстры точно знают, откуда был брошен источник звука (чашки, бутылки) = использовать их бесполезно.

Дальше пошла жесть против Демона. Эта тварь вообще непредсказуемая. Первый раз убил меня резко на повороте, хотя даже музыки не было, ни звука, ничего. Я даже ещё не знал, какой из монстров мне выпал, а оно уже за углом. Честно? Фиг там! Второй раз спрятался в комнате, взял огнетушитель в руки, Демон магическим образом телепортировался внутрь сквозь дверь и встал ко мне спиной. К сожалению, тушить его спину оказалось бессмысленно, так как эффекта не дало. Следующая игра с демоном кончилась тем, что он, опять же, игнорируя отвлечение звуком и мои карачки, точно вычислил моё местоположение и резко запер дверь передом носом... Беда в том, что в этой двери я застрял, так что не смог сдвинуться и подох.

Или ситуация, когда я спускался по лестнице с 7 этажа на первый, но Ползун всёравно меня вычислил, прошел все этажи, пробежал ещё минуты 2 по закоулкам и поворотам и всёравно прибил. Иногда он нормальный, а иногда включается какой-то глупый скрипт и Ползун становится в 3 раза агрессивнее, глазастее и умнее. Прятаться вообще бесполезно, только трятишь зря время и силы. И ещё, монстры телепортируются по кораблю, что изрядно убивает часть фана и атмосферы. Если я его отвлёк в другую часть корабля, то пусть там и отсаётся, я это заслужил!

СЛИШКОМ много багов на каждом шагу. Ещё и подёргивается экран с какого-то перепугу. Вроде бы FPS от 40 до 60, а ощущения, будто 10. Настройки менял = не помогло.

Игру однозначно рекомендую, но вот такие казусы будут основной причиной ваших проигрышей. Я весь вечер потратил впустую, натыкаясь на баг за багом, раз за разом проигрывая. Надоело уже. С тем же успехом можете поглядеть кино на YouTube, где кто-то другой проходит. Хоть не так будет обидно.

20533192.review:
Great game! I really like it. Atmosphere is good, monsters are intimidating, it reminds me so much of [i] Outlast [/i]!

If i had to give constructive criticism, It would have to be towards the endings. Finally escaping the ship and the monster feels like an acomplishment. The simple ending pictures shown of you escaping is just a bit bland. I recommend making it so escaping has more feeling to it. After entering the raft/submarine/helicopter, show a cutscene of the player activating the escape and leaving the ship before cutting to a picture of the said escape route.

For example:

[h1] Raft- [/h1] Show the player jumping on the raft and getting lowered to sea. While slowly drifting away, they look back at the ship as it fades to black.

Extra- If the Brute was the selected monster, the player would see it standing at the edge of the ship as they drift away, making one last roar as it fades to black.

[h1] Helecopter- [/h1] Show the player getting in the helecopter, activating it, and taking off to the sky as it fades to black.

Extra- If the Hunter was the selected monster, it will jump on the windshield right after take off, startling the player. They will then spin the helecopter until it flys off. Then the player would fly away as it fades to black.

[h1] Submarine- [/h1] Show the player getting in, starting the controls, and drive away into the sea as it fades to black.

Extra- If the Fiend was the selected monster, the player would turn around and see the Fiend in a door way. They would get in, start flailing with the controls, as the Fiend is heard trying to get in. The player then swims away, as the Fiend's cry is faintly heard, as it fades to black.

That's all I've got. Hopefully it helps with any future upadates that may occur. Once again, great game! :)

20415438.review:
Monstrum is probably the scariest game I've ever played. I beat the helicopter ending and livestreamed beating the submarine which took about an hour and a half (and was super fun). It's been able to stay just as terrifying every single time I've played it, which is really awesome. Most horror games wear off eventually, but this one has been able to scare me just as much every time with its randomly generated decks and 3 totally different monsters (which it chooses from randomly). The chases still get my heart pumping. As you collect more items for your escape, the stakes get higher and higher so it keeps getting more intense. I also like how different the escape routes are from eachother (ranging from fairly easy to super intense.)

The only problem is that most of the time I've always had only 1 item left to get, and it takes 90% of the time to get just that item ; usually I've had to spend over half an hour just trying to find, for example, the helicopter keys somewhere on the ship. Of course, that happening mostly depends on your luck, but it happens a lot to me and everyone that I've seen play the game. One other tiny critisism is that steam vents can kill you after a few hits, which is lame. They should just always stun you.

Overall, though, this game is AMAZINGLY scary, and I got a lot more fun out of it than I expected. I highly recommend it!

20343049.review:
Monstrum es sin duda un survival horror bien hecho, si bien su historia es algo simple y ya vista, el sistema de juego que tiene hace que eso sea lo menos importante.

Empiezas en un barco sin saber nada y debes hayar la forma de escapar (Mediate el Helicoptero, submarino, etc..) sin embargo algo que hay que admirar es que no todas las partidas te resultaran iguales, a veces puedes aparecer en los niveles bajos del barco y en otros arriba, al veces con un monstruo detras, otro te lo encuentras en el proceso de que arreglas tus vias de escape, Considero a Monstrum un Survival Horror diferente a otros de su estilo, como ya dije quiza su historia no sea tanto su punto fuerte, pero lo arregla con detalles que no se ven en todos los SH, pues tiene una atmosfera aterradora, que te mantiene todo el tiempo alerta, cuando por fin ves que el monstruo te sigue sin duda sientes esa emocion y terror, Vale la pena la compra si te gustan los juegos de terror.

20266494.review:
А я думал это Амнезия страшная игра. 
Данное творение, лично для меня, её переплюнуло. И вот ведь парадокс, даже играя на 20-30 раз, когда вроде бы все знаешь, и монстров уже изучил, научился определять их приближение и т.д. - а все равно стоит услышать позади жуткий вой и вторящее ему музыкальное сопровождение и адреналин подскакивает моментально! И вот ты уже бежишь не разбирая дороги, лишь бы найти хоть какое-нибудь укрытие и спрятаться. И отсидется-то, вместе с тем, не получится ибо игра не подразумевает пассивный геймплей. Реальная ЖУТЬ, в хорошем смысле этого слова.

Да, если вы вдруг удивились тому что я написал "играя 20-30 раз", думая про себя "зачем вообще играть в такого плана игры помногу раз? прошел и забыл", то спешу обрадовать (а может огорчить, кому как) - это не стандартный линейный хоррор\сурвайвл с сюжетом, по типу упомянутой уже Амнезии. Это сессионка. Да да, вы не ослышались, именно сессионка и сюжета, тут нет. Весь сюжет умещается в одном предложении - вы очнулись на корабле, с жутким монстром и вам надо с него выбраться. Все. Ну т.е. есть еще, конечно, определенная история подаваемая игроку в виде 21 записки (нужен хороший английский чтобы все понять)  и 12 звуковых сообщений (а вот тут боюсь даже со знанием языка будут проблемы) ныне покойного экипажа данного корабля, но откровенно говоря это все так.., чтоб уж совсем народ не придирался.
Ну так вот, спавнитесь вы, значит, в каюте и вперед - собирать всякое барахлишко, которое поможет вам удрать с корабля, попутно прячась от разъяренной твари которая ходит за вами по пятам.
Геймплей, к слову, очень напоминает Alien: Isolation,  разве что монстры здесь не такие читаки как Чужой и не бродят все время в 20 метрах от вас.

Сразу говорю, пройти с 1, 5 и даже 10 раза у вас не получится (разве что Великий Рандом сжалится над вами, но я бы на него не расчитывал), так что если идея провести кучу часов в однообразных, в общем-то, "забегах" по кораблю вас не прельщает, то эта игра не для вас.
Ну, а если это для вас не критично, то настоятельно рекомендую к приобретению. Простенькая (по исполнению, не по геймплею), но реально пугающая, атмосферная и, самое главное, ИНТЕРЕСНАЯ игра.

10 "да где этот гребаный последний предмет для починки!" из 10.

4. Ждать загрузки [2]

20129480.review:
Durch die Updates ist das Spiel wirklich gut geworden (deutsche Untertitel wären nur noch toll).
3 verschiedene Monster, 3 Möglichkeiten zu entkommen (jetzt auch mit Endsequenz) und einige Collectables in Form von Notizen und Audiologs.
Für jeden Fluchtweg gibt es bestimmte Items, die man benötigt und auf dem großen Frachtschiff finden muss, auf dem man alleine erwacht - naja, nicht ganz allein...!
Das Spiel setzt weniger auf Jumpscares, sondern auf atmosphärische Geräusche/Musik und der ständigen Angst, dass der Verfolger einen entdeckt - denn Kampf ist hier keine Option, nur fliehen und verstecken.
Auch grafisch ist Monstrum ansehnlich gestaltet und die Steuerung ist sehr angenehm, sowie verstellbar.

20105691.review: Идёшь такой по коридору, шипение - обосрался. Оказалось просто пар... Идёшь дальше (а вес штанов уже перетягивает) какой-то скрип - обосрался. Оказалось просто корабль старый, конструкция уже не выдерживает... Идёшь дальше нашёл пару фюзов, канистру разбавленного мочой бензина, моток знатной стальной цепи (и как-то всё в одну руку помещается) и вот вроде бы ты рад, латулатся, ВДРУГ БАЦ! Просто ни откуда вылазит скелет одетый в эктоплазму! Тут ты уже конкретно обсираешься, добавляя лишние пару килограмм к тем, что уже висят в штанах. И на утёк. Через 25 км. весёлого кроса с монстром ты можешь вспомнить, что где-то в комнатах есть кровати, под которые можно залезть и шкафчики в которых можно спрятаться, залезая в одно такое убежище можно отсидеться там пару часиков, постирать трусы, посмотреть видео с котятками.. Главно убедиться что это нечто точно отстало... А иначе... ВЫТАЩИТ, ВЫЕБ.. Кмх-кмх ВЫПОТРОШИТ и бросит гнить в темноте.
